@@ -34,7 +34,7 @@\n

===Leterme I===
{{Main|Leterme I Government}}
-An official coalition agreement was signed on 18 March 2008. [[Yves Leterme]] was sworn in on 20 March 2008. In the late hours of 14 July 2008, after months of negotiations regarding the constitutional reform and electoral arrondissement Brussels-Halle-Vilvoorde failed and with the deadline of 15 July 2008 within reach, Leterme offered the resignation of his cabinet to [[Albert II of Belgium|King Albert II]]. After a series of consultations, King Albert II decided to reject Prime Minister Leterme's resignation on 17 July. The royal palace said that the King had asked two senior French-speaking politicians, [[Minister of State#Netherlands and Belgium|Ministers of State]] [[François-Xavier de Donnea]] ([[Mouvement Réformateur|MR]]) and [[Raymond Langendries]] ([[Centre démocrate humaniste|CdH]]), and the [[Minister-President]] of the [[German-speaking Community of Belgium|German-speaking Community]], [[Karl-Heinz Lambertz]] ([[Socialist Party (francophone Belgium)|SP]]), to establish how to start talks about institutional reform.{{cite web|url=http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/1.340848 |title=Crisis in de Wetstraat |publisher=Deredactie.be |date=18 July 2008 |accessdate=2011-03-17}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7512975.stm |title=Belgian PM's resignation rejected |publisher=BBC News |date=17 July 2008 |accessdate=2011-03-17}} They reported back to the King on 19 September 2008 with a one-page report so that neither of the communities would back out of the negotiations.{{cite web|url=http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/1.382990 |title=deredactie.be - "Onderhandelen over grote staatshervorming" |publisher=Deredactie.be |date= |accessdate=27 December 2008}} Only a few hours later, [[Didier Reynders]] angered the Dutch-speaking politicians with controversial statements and so sparked a crisis within the Flemish government. On 21 September 2008, the N-VA withdrew its parliamentary support for the federal government, saying that the 15-month-long negotiations had failed to result in state reform. The withdrawal of support plunged the country into another crisis.[http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080921_nva_congres NVA zegt steun op] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080921142009/http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080921_nva_congres |date=September 21, 2008 }} Under pressure of the socialist and liberal coalition partners, the only N-VA minister in the Flemish government ([[Geert Bourgeois]]) resigned his post.[http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080922_bourgeois_ontslag Bourgeois neemt ontslag] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080923071618/http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080922_bourgeois_ontslag |date=September 23, 2008 }}
+An official coalition agreement was signed on 18 March 2008. [[Yves Leterme]] was sworn in on 20 March 2008. In the late hours of 14 July 2008, after months of negotiations regarding the constitutional reform and electoral arrondissement Brussels-Halle-Vilvoorde failed and with the deadline of 15 July 2008 within reach, Leterme offered the resignation of his cabinet to [[Albert II of Belgium|King Albert II]]. After a series of consultations, King Albert II decided to reject Prime Minister Leterme's resignation on 17 July. The royal palace said that the King had asked two senior French-speaking politicians, [[Minister of State#Netherlands and Belgium|Ministers of State]] [[François-Xavier de Donnea]] ([[Mouvement Réformateur|MR]]) and [[Raymond Langendries]] ([[Centre démocrate humaniste|CdH]]), and the [[Minister-President]] of the [[German-speaking Community of Belgium|German-speaking Community]], [[Karl-Heinz Lambertz]] ([[Socialist Party (francophone Belgium)|SP]]), to establish how to start talks about institutional reform.{{cite web|url=http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/1.340848 |title=Crisis in de Wetstraat |publisher=Deredactie.be |date=18 July 2008 |accessdate=2011-03-17}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7512975.stm |title=Belgian PM's resignation rejected |publisher=BBC News |date=17 July 2008 |accessdate=2011-03-17}} They reported back to the King on 19 September 2008 with a one-page report so that neither of the communities would back out of the negotiations.{{cite web|url=http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/1.382990 |title=deredactie.be - "Onderhandelen over grote staatshervorming" |publisher=Deredactie.be |date= |accessdate=27 December 2008}} Only a few hours later, [[Didier Reynders]] angered the Dutch-speaking politicians with controversial statements and so sparked a crisis within the Flemish government. On 21 September 2008, the N-VA withdrew its parliamentary support for the federal government, saying that the 15-month-long negotiations had failed to result in state reform. The withdrawal of support plunged the country into another crisis.[http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080921_nva_congres NVA zegt steun op] {{Wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080921_nva_congres|date =20080921142009 }} Under pressure of the socialist and liberal coalition partners, the only N-VA minister in the Flemish government ([[Geert Bourgeois]]) resigned his post.[http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080922_bourgeois_ontslag Bourgeois neemt ontslag] {{Wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.deredactie.be/cm/de.redactie/politiek/080922_bourgeois_ontslag|date =20080923071618 }}

On 19 December 2008, Leterme again offered the resignation of the government to the king, who accepted the offer on 22 December. The resignation was offered after news broke out that the government had tried to intervene in the verdict of the Fortis case.
2016-11-14 04:38:25 749408235 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by Dl2000 --- \n
+++ \n
@@ -42,11 +42,11 @@\n
==Non-military service==
{{Main|Siviilipalvelus}}
{{See also|Arndt Pekurinen}}
-Non-military service has a fixed length of 347 dayshttp://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/2007/20071446?search%5Btype%5D=pika&search%5Bpika%5D=siviilipalveluslaki#L1P4. Finlex. Retrieved 4-17-2013. {{fi}}. and consists of basic training and the actual service. The basic training takes place in the Lapinjärvi civilian service centre and lasts 28 days. During basic training, the serviceman is given instruction in first aid, peace education, internationalism, and non-violent resistance. In addition, some trainees receive an anti-oil leak or non-violent activity training.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/koulutusjakso.html Sivarin arki koulutusjakson aikana]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}}. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071018024907/http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/koulutusjakso.html |date=October 18, 2007 }} During the basic training, the civilian servicemen have training during weekdays from 8.00 until 16.00. On Fridays, the service usually ends before noon, while weekends are off. The servicemen are allowed to leave the service center freely during their free time, and may, if they wish, live at their homes during the basic training.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/faq.htm#Koulutusjakso Kysymyksiä ja vastauksia]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071022030711/http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/faq.htm#Koulutusjakso |date=October 22, 2007 }}
+Non-military service has a fixed length of 347 dayshttp://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/2007/20071446?search%5Btype%5D=pika&search%5Bpika%5D=siviilipalveluslaki#L1P4. Finlex. Retrieved 4-17-2013. {{fi}}. and consists of basic training and the actual service. The basic training takes place in the Lapinjärvi civilian service centre and lasts 28 days. During basic training, the serviceman is given instruction in first aid, peace education, internationalism, and non-violent resistance. In addition, some trainees receive an anti-oil leak or non-violent activity training.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/koulutusjakso.html Sivarin arki koulutusjakson aikana]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}}. {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/koulutusjakso.html |date=20071018024907 }} During the basic training, the civilian servicemen have training during weekdays from 8.00 until 16.00. On Fridays, the service usually ends before noon, while weekends are off. The servicemen are allowed to leave the service center freely during their free time, and may, if they wish, live at their homes during the basic training.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/faq.htm#Koulutusjakso Kysymyksiä ja vastauksia]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/koulutusjakso_lapinjarvella/faq.htm#Koulutusjakso |date=20071022030711 }}

-For the actual service period, the serviceman is required to obtain a service place, which must have an agreement with the civilian service center. During the actual service period, the place of service is responsible for the health care and maintenance of the serviceman. The serviceman is obligated to work for 40 hours a week at times prescribed by the place of service. He has the right to enjoy a continuous daily rest period hours of 8 hours, however. The work is carried out according to the usual civilian [[European Agency for Safety and Health at Work|OSHA]] regulations. During his free time, the serviceman is allowed to leave the premises of the service place freely.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/10_tyojavapaa.htm Työ ja vapaa-aika]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070730114829/http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/10_tyojavapaa.htm |date=July 30, 2007 }} During the service and basic training, the serviceman receives the same daily allowance as the conscript.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/08_yllapito.htm#paivaraha Ylläpito]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071028122148/http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/08_yllapito.htm#paivaraha |date=October 28, 2007 }} During the service, the serviceman is entitled to receive 18 days of leave, in addition to his free time. In addition to this leave, he may receive a maximum of 20 days of leave for good performance.[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/2007/20071446 ''Siviilipalveluslaki]'' (1446/2008). Chapter 40. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}}
+For the actual service period, the serviceman is required to obtain a service place, which must have an agreement with the civilian service center. During the actual service period, the place of service is responsible for the health care and maintenance of the serviceman. The serviceman is obligated to work for 40 hours a week at times prescribed by the place of service. He has the right to enjoy a continuous daily rest period hours of 8 hours, however. The work is carried out according to the usual civilian [[European Agency for Safety and Health at Work|OSHA]] regulations. During his free time, the serviceman is allowed to leave the premises of the service place freely.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/10_tyojavapaa.htm Työ ja vapaa-aika]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/10_tyojavapaa.htm |date=20070730114829 }} During the service and basic training, the serviceman receives the same daily allowance as the conscript.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/08_yllapito.htm#paivaraha Ylläpito]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/08_yllapito.htm#paivaraha |date=20071028122148 }} During the service, the serviceman is entitled to receive 18 days of leave, in addition to his free time. In addition to this leave, he may receive a maximum of 20 days of leave for good performance.[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/2007/20071446 ''Siviilipalveluslaki]'' (1446/2008). Chapter 40. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}}

-If the serviceman does not comply with his duties and obligations or is absent, the service place is obligated to inform the civilian service center, which carries out an investigation. For minor infractions, the serviceman may be punished administratively. The punishment consists of a written warning, extra work (maximum 4 hours/day for five days), or the loss of daily allowance for a maximum of 30 days. If the infractions are continuous, the civilian service center reports the serviceman to the police and discharges him. After this, the serviceman is usually convicted of civilian service crime to prison for a time that corresponds half of his remaining term of service. No [[parole]] is available. The same punishment applies to those who make a written denunciation of their service obligation. After serving the prison term, the former inmate is freed of his remaining peace-time service obligations.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/12_kurinpito.htm#kurinpito Kuripito ja oikeusturva]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070730115002/http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/12_kurinpito.htm#kurinpito |date=July 30, 2007 }}
+If the serviceman does not comply with his duties and obligations or is absent, the service place is obligated to inform the civilian service center, which carries out an investigation. For minor infractions, the serviceman may be punished administratively. The punishment consists of a written warning, extra work (maximum 4 hours/day for five days), or the loss of daily allowance for a maximum of 30 days. If the infractions are continuous, the civilian service center reports the serviceman to the police and discharges him. After this, the serviceman is usually convicted of civilian service crime to prison for a time that corresponds half of his remaining term of service. No [[parole]] is available. The same punishment applies to those who make a written denunciation of their service obligation. After serving the prison term, the former inmate is freed of his remaining peace-time service obligations.[http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/12_kurinpito.htm#kurinpito Kuripito ja oikeusturva]. Lapinjärven koulutuskeskus. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}} {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.sivarikeskus.fi/siviilipalvelusmiehen_opas/12_kurinpito.htm#kurinpito |date=20070730115002 }}

After their service, the civilian servicemen belong to the civil reserve (''siviilivaranto'') until the end of their 50th life year. After this, they belong to the civil militia (''lisävaranto'') until the end of their 60th life year. During this time, they may be activated for extra training, if the international tension rises to the level where military reserves are activated. During a mobilization, the civilian servicemen may be mobilized and assigned duties in civil defence, rescue authorities or environmental authorities. In case of general mobilization, the parliament may give permission to activate even the civil militia. The "total objectors", who have served a prison term for refusing civilian service, receive no exceptions. The activated or mobilized servicemen receive the same pay as rank-and-file reservists.[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/2007/20071446 ''Siviilipalveluslaki]'' (1446/2008). Chapter 9 and § 50. Retrieved 2-29-2008. {{fi}}
2007-04-02 04:30:02 119649374 AntiVandalBot MartinBot BOT - rv [[Special:Contributions/MartinBot|MartinBot]] ([[User talk:MartinBot|talk]]) to last version by 75.74.65.57 --- \n
+++ \n
@@ -1,121 +1 @@\n
-'''The dozens''' is an [[oral tradition]] in which two people go toe-to-toe in a contest of often bad-natured, often [[ribald]] "[[trash-talk]]". They take turns [[insult]]ing; "burning", "capping", "cracking", "heating", "ranking", "sparking", "sunning", "janking", "snapping", "checking", "riding", "frying", "cooking", "jonein'", "cutting one up", "projectoring" or even "pwning/owning" (on online games) {{Fact|date=February 2007}} — on one another, their adversary's mother, or other family member until one of them has no [[comeback]]. In addition to any of the terms listed above, playing the dozens can also be referred to as a "cut-low fight," or simply an "insult fight." Similar traditions exist in other [[Western world|Western cultures]].
-
-

-{{AfricanAmerican}}
-

-
-Each putdown, or ''snap'', ups the ante. Defeat can be humiliating, but a skilled contender, win or lose, may gain [[respect]]. The dozens is part of the African American oral tradition of wordplay and verbal sparring, elements evident in the [[Roots of hip hop music|development of hip-hop]], especially the practice of ''[[freestyle battle|freestyle battling]]''. Being defeated by an opponent is often referred to as ''being served''. Being served may cause a loss of street [[credibility|cred]] or credibility.
-
-==History and practice==
-The dozens can be a harmless game of casual, good-natured jibes, an exchange of malicious insults, [[taunt]]s or, if tempers flare, a prelude to physical violence. While the competition usually seems light-hearted, smiles sometimes mask real tensions. In its purest form, the dozens is part of a custom of verbal sparring, of "[[wolf ticket|woofin']]" and "[[Signifying|signifyin']]" ostensibly intended to defuse conflict nonviolently, descended from oral traditions of indigenous West African cultures. {{Fact|date=February 2007}}
-The contest is generally judged informally by any onlookers or bystanders who may be watching. The dozens is a battle for the respect of onlookers and is rarely seen without spectators. The onlookers express approval or disapproval with laughter, jeers, or slang filled catcalls such as, "Ohhhhh! Burn!."
-
-The term ''the dozens'' is believed to refer to the devaluing on the auction block of slaves who were past their prime, deformed, aged, or no longer capable of hard labor after years of back-breaking toil. These slaves often were sold by the dozen. In "Still Laughing to Keep from Crying: [[Black humor|Black Humor]]," African American author and professor Mona Lisa Saloy writes:
-
-
The dozens has its origins in the slave trade of New Orleans where deformed slaves—generally slaves punished with dismemberment for disobedience—were grouped in lots of a 'cheap dozen' for sale to slave owners. For a Black to be sold as part of the 'dozens' was the lowest blow possible.{{cite web|author=Mona Lisa Saloy|year=2001|url=http://www.louisianafolklife.org/LT/Articles_Essays/still_laugh.html|title=Still Laughing to Keep from Crying: Black Humor|work=Louisiana Folklife Festival booklet|accessdate=2005-11-15}}

-
-"Yo' momma" is a common, widely recognized retort in slang. It is a cryptic and sometimes comical allusion to the dozens. A more extended version is the '''[[Yo Momma]] joke''', the most common way of playing the dozens, using a mix of exaggeration or even pop culture references to talk about the health, size, age, skin color, or sexual promiscuity of the opponent's mother (fathers and sisters are also popular targets, as well as the person they are insulting):
-
-::''Yo momma so fat, she jumped in the air and got stuck!''
-::''Yo momma so dumb, she thought a [[quarterback]] was a refund!''
-::''Yo momma so old, when God said: "Let there be light," she threw the switch!''
-::''Yo momma's teeth is so yellow, [[I Can't Believe It's Not Butter]]!''
-::''Yo momma so stupid, she got hit by a parked car!''
-::''Yo momma so stupid, she died of hunger in a supermarket!''
-::''Yo mamma so stupid, she put a quarter in a parking meter and said "Where's my gumball?"''
-::''Yo momma so stupid, she stole a free sample.''
-Children have been known to express contempt or defiance by reciting a short poem that refers to the dozens, but in which the insults are mostly implied:
-
-::Yo' momma, Yo' daddy, Yo' sista, too. Go tell them bitches, go back to the zoo.
-
-::Yo' momma, Yo' daddy, Yo' bald-head granny, Yo Grandma's Grandma's Cousin's Uncle Dog
-
-::Yo' momma, Yo' daddy, Yo' greasy-greasy granny, with the hole in her panty, goin' Beep-Beep-Beep down Sesame Street
-
-::Yo' momma, Yo' daddy, Yo' bald-head granny, she ninty one, she ninty two, she [[Sex|gettin down]] with [[Pikachu]]
-
-::She ninety-nine. She think she fine. She had a date with [[Frankenstein]]
-
-::Your mom gave birth to a dog named Jimmy, than Jimmy had your mom!
-
-==The dozens in literature and the performing arts==
-
-[[Kokomo Arnold]], one of the first popular American [[blues]] musicians of the [[1930s]], released a song ''Twelves (Dirty Dozens)'' that includes lyrics such as:
-
-::I like yo' momma—sister, too
-::I did like your poppa—but your poppa wouldn't do
-::I met your poppa on the corner the other day
-::I soon found out he as funny that way.
-::Yo Momma, Yo Daddy, yo greasy greasy grandnanny (As documented in the song 'Ooh, Stick You!' by Daphne and Celeste)
-
-In [[Zora Neale Hurston]]'s, ''[[Their Eyes Were Watching God]]'' (1937), there is reference to "playin' de dozens" in front of Joe's store.
-
-Comedian [[George Carlin]] talks about playing the dozens on his [[Grammy]]-winning 1972 album ''[[Occupation: Foole]]''.
-
-::You wanna play the dozens
-::well the dozens is a game
-::but the way I'm fucking your mother
-::is a godamn shame.
-
-In [[Ralph Ellison]]'s ''[[Invisible Man]]'', published in 1952, the narrator/protagonist is treated in a factory hospital following an explosion. On page 241 of the paperback edition: "I looked at him, feeling a quick dislike and thinking, half in amusement, I don't play the dozens." Ellison's correspondence with his friend, writer and fellow [[Tuskegee]] student, [[Albert Murray (writer)|Albert Murray]], is titled ''Trading Twelves'', which refers to competition among jazz musicians, who trade twelve bar solos, raising the ante each time.
-
-On the sitcom ''[[Benson (TV series)|Benson]]'' (episode unknown) Benson and Clayton compete in a formal 'Dozens' competition.
-
-[[Alternative hip-hop]] group [[The Pharcyde]] released a song on their debut album ''[[Bizarre Ride II: The Pharcyde]]'' entitled "Ya' Mama", the lyrics of which consist entirely of snaps. A remix of this song is used as the theme of MTV's trash-talk show ''[[Yo Momma]]'' (see below for more information about the show). The [[Australian hip-hop]] group [[Butterfingers]] have a song called "Yo Momma" that includes the chorus "Yo Momma's on the top of my things-to-do list." In addition, underground hip-hop artist [[Count Bass D]] begins his album [[Pre-Life Crisis]] with a song about snaps called "The Dozens."
-
-The book ''Snaps'' (1994), written by James Percely, is a compendium of over 450 jokes. Its popularity gave rise to sequels ''Double Snaps'' (1995), ''Triple Snaps'' (1996), and ''Snaps 4'' (1998). The books use the epithet "your mother", as opposed to the more common "yo' momma". The book series spawned a television series titled ''Snaps'' which ran briefly on [[HBO]]. The movies ''[[White Men Can't Jump]]'', ''[[Remember the Titans]]'', ''[[8 Mile]]'', and ''[[House Party]]'' include exchanges of snaps.
-
-In a recurring ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' sketch from the [[1990s]] entitled "I'm Chillin'", which was presented as an inner-city public-access talk show, the host (played by then-castmember [[Chris Rock]]) would regularly present a segment entitled "Mother Joke of the Day". Rock's character would present a "mother joke" submitted by a fictitious viewer, after which [[Don Pardo]] would describe a fictitious prize to be awarded to the viewer in question, including a beverage known as "F'd Up Malt Liquor".
-
-The [[Wayans Brothers|Keenan Ivory Wayans]] TV show ''[[In Living Color]]'' regularly featured a game show segment titled ''The Dirty Dozens'' and parodies of popular game shows, such as ''[[Wheel of Fortune (US game show)|Wheel of Dozens]]'' and ''[[Family Feud|Family Dozens]]''. Their brothers, Shawn and Marlon, have also been involved in these, so much so that in 2004, they released a mobile phone game based on ''The Dozens'', as well as a card game.
-
-The book ''A Portrait of Yo Mama As a Young Man'' (2005), written by Andrew Barlow and Kent Roberts, is a [[postmodernism|postmodern]] take on the dozens which redefines the form through the use of reflexivity, absurdism, and anti-humor. In addition to jokes, the book contains charts, poetry, a résumé, and various other short humor pieces. The title is derived from [[James Joyce|James Joyce's]] ''[[A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man]]''.
-
-The title of the [[Mexico|Mexican]] film ''[[Y tu mamá también]]'' (literally, "And your mother, too") is taken from a scene in the movie where in the two young male protagonists do their equivalent of the dozens.
-
-In 2006, [[MTV]] premiered a [[game show]] titled ''[[Yo Momma]]'' [[executive producer|executive produced]] and [[game show host|hosted]] by [[Wilmer Valderrama]]. Contestants face off in playing the dozens. The person judged to be the funniest wins a cash prize. The four winners from that week then face off in a final round, where the weekly winner gets another cash prize and additional prizes as well.
-
-In the TV series, ''The Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy'', Grim's scythe turns Billy and Mandy's school principal, Principal Goodvibes, into a semi-rapper; he insults Grim's momma once, and is seen having a dozens competition with Erwin that Goodvibes loses badly. Then the grandmother steps in and plays the dozens with the principal, who loses again.
-
-Fictional artist [[MC Hawking]] (a gangsta-rapping parody of theoretical physicist [[Stephen Hawking]]) has a song called "The Dozens" on his CD ''A Brief History of Rhyme: MC Hawking's Greatest Hits'', where he raps "yo momma" jokes like "Yo momma's such a slut, the other night I had to park my dick on her ass and wait an hour to get in."
-
-Award-winning author and [[University of California, Los Angeles]] professor Mike Rose refers to "running the dozens" in his oft-anthologized essay, "I Just Wanna Be Average". ("Tyrrell was the coolest kid I knew. He ran the dozens like a metric halfback...")
-
-In jazz, at least three pieces have dozens-related titles: "Yo' Mama's Mambo" which pianist/composer [[Horace Silver]] plays; "How's Your Mama" which alto saxophonist/composer [[Phil Woods]] plays as his theme song; and "Yo Mama", a blues which trumpeter [[Jack Sheldon]] usually sandwiches between his own versions of the dozens.
-
-In the 2001 film ''[[Heist (film)|Heist]]'', written and directed by [[David Mamet]], [[Gene Hackman]]'s character Joe Moore assaults an adversary and subsequently asks him, "You want to play the dozens? Huh? Here we go. There was an error at the hospital, you died at birth, your turn."
-
-== The dozens in other cultures ==
-
-Historically, similar verbal competitions were practiced in other cultures. Ancient Germanic cultures, including the Norse and Anglo-Saxons, practiced a ritual exchange of insults known as [[flyting]], which is similar in function to the dozens. In sixteenth-century [[Scotland]], the term flyting was used to describe an exchange of abusive poems by poets. [[Arab]] poets exchanged creative insults in ''naqa'id'', a practice continued in the ''zajal'' verbal jousting of present-day [[Lebanon]]. American [[cowboy]]s in the late nineteenth century participated in '''cussing contests''', the winners of which were sometimes rewarded with new saddles.
-
-In Shakespeare's England insult competitions were common, with professional experts who were known as 'roarers'. Ben Jonson (a contemporary of Shakespeare) wrote a comedy, 'The Roarer', about a foppish young man who hires a roarer to teach him the art so that he can best his wife-to-be in arguments. Some aspects of insults are discussed in the essay 'Lars Porsena, or the Future of Swearing in the English Language' by the English poet Robert Graves.
-
-Outside of insult contests, the phrase "[[Mother insult|your mom]]" is also used as a serious insult or general retort.
-

@@ -1,19 +1,19 @@\n
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2015}}
{{Use British English|date=June 2015}}
-'''Respect Renewal''' was a faction that existed during the 2007-8 split within [[Respect – The Unity Coalition]] a UK political party.{{Cite web|url=http://www.respectrenewal.org/content/view/58/74/|title=Respect Constitution|publisher=Respect Renewal|year=2004|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080428005317/http://www.respectrenewal.org/content/view/58/74/|archivedate=2008-04-28|deadurl=yes|}}
+'''Respect Renewal''' was a faction that existed during the 2007-8 split within [[Respect – The Unity Coalition]] a UK political party.{{Cite web|url=http://www.respectrenewal.org/content/view/58/74/|title=Respect Constitution|publisher=Respect Renewal|year=2004|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080428005317/http://www.respectrenewal.org/content/view/58/74/|archivedate=2008-04-28|deadurl=yes|}}

Respect Renewal was led by Linda Smith, the National Chair, Leader and Nominating Officer of Respect, and was formed in November 2007. Its supporters included [[George Galloway]], [[Ken Loach]], Victoria Brittain, [[Salma Yaqoob]] and Nick Wrack.

==History==
{{main|Respect - The Unity Coalition#The split in Respect}}
-In September 2007, Galloway wrote a letter to Respect's national council members saying that the party was "too disorganised" and "faced oblivion" unless it reformed its internal party management.{{Cite web|url=http://www.themuslimweekly.com/fullstoryview.aspx?NewsID=215082B330A483E173B045F1&MENUID=HOMENEWS&DESCRIPTION=UK%20News|title=Galloway slams own Respect party|publisher=[[The Muslim Weekly]]|date=14 September 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071105232630/http://www.themuslimweekly.com/fullstoryview.aspx?NewsID=215082B330A483E173B045F1&MENUID=HOMENEWS&DESCRIPTION=UK%20News|archivedate=2007-11-05 |deadurl=yes}} This was the beginning of a dispute within Respect between Galloway and his supporters and the [[Socialist Workers Party (UK)|Socialist Workers Party]] (SWP) on the other side.
+In September 2007, Galloway wrote a letter to Respect's national council members saying that the party was "too disorganised" and "faced oblivion" unless it reformed its internal party management.{{Cite web|url=http://www.themuslimweekly.com/fullstoryview.aspx?NewsID=215082B330A483E173B045F1&MENUID=HOMENEWS&DESCRIPTION=UK%20News|title=Galloway slams own Respect party|publisher=[[The Muslim Weekly]]|date=14 September 2007|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20071105232630/http://www.themuslimweekly.com/fullstoryview.aspx?NewsID=215082B330A483E173B045F1&MENUID=HOMENEWS&DESCRIPTION=UK%20News|archivedate=2008-04-28|deadurl=yes}} This was the beginning of a dispute within Respect between Galloway and his supporters and the [[Socialist Workers Party (UK)|Socialist Workers Party]] (SWP) on the other side.

-On 3 November 2007, Galloway's camp announced plans to hold the Respect Renewal conference on 17 November, the same day as the planned national conference of Respect. The Respect Renewal conference was an open event and organisers claim 350 people attended, comparable with the Respect national conference, although the figure has been disputed.{{Cite web|url=http://www.isj.org.uk/index.php4?id=396&issue=117|title=The Crisis in Respect|accessdate=2008-01-05|publisher=[[International Socialism journal]]|year=2008|author=Chris Harman|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090331122555/http://www.isj.org.uk/index.php4?id=396&issue=117|archivedate=2009-03-31|deadurl=no}} This split continued with both Respect Renewal and the SWP-led faction claiming to be the real Respect. Respect Renewal, through Linda Smith, had control over the use of the Respect name in elections, while the SWP-led faction used the electoral label [[Left List]], but did control the original Respect website's URL. Both the Respect Renewal faction, as 'Respect (George Galloway)', and Left List stood in the [[London Assembly election, 2008|2008 London Assembly elections]]. Neither party won a seat or did as well as Respect did in the [[London Assembly election, 2004|2004 elections]], but 'Respect (George Galloway)' outpolled Left List.
+On 3 November 2007, Galloway's camp announced plans to hold the Respect Renewal conference on 17 November, the same day as the planned national conference of Respect. The Respect Renewal conference was an open event and organisers claim 350 people attended, comparable with the Respect national conference, although the figure has been disputed.{{Cite web|url=http://www.isj.org.uk/index.php4?id=396&issue=117|title=The Crisis in Respect|accessdate=2008-01-05|publisher=[[International Socialism journal]]|year=2008|author=Chris Harman|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20090331122555/http://www.isj.org.uk/index.php4?id=396&issue=117|archivedate=2009-03-31|deadurl=no}} This split continued with both Respect Renewal and the SWP-led faction claiming to be the real Respect. Respect Renewal, through Linda Smith, had control over the use of the Respect name in elections, while the SWP-led faction used the electoral label [[Left List]], but did control the original Respect website's URL. Both the Respect Renewal faction, as 'Respect (George Galloway)', and Left List stood in the [[London Assembly election, 2008|2008 London Assembly elections]]. Neither party won a seat or did as well as Respect did in the [[London Assembly election, 2004|2004 elections]], but 'Respect (George Galloway)' outpolled Left List.

The split was finally resolved in October 2008, when the Left List ended its claim on the Respect name.

==Criticisms of Respect Renewal==
-The SWP has attributed the split within Respect to a shift to the right by George Galloway and his allies, motivated by electoralism (placing election-winning above other principles). This, say the SWP leadership, led to attacks on the SWP as the most prominent left group in Respect.{{cite web|url=http://www.swp.org.uk/respect_cc.php|title=The record: The Socialist Workers Party and Respect|author=SWP Central Committee Statement|date=2007-11-03|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080907150924/http://www.swp.org.uk/respect_cc.php|archivedate=2008-09-07|deadurl=yes}} This interpretation of events is countered by Respect Renewal, which criticises the SWP for opportunism and lack of democracy.{{cite web|url=http://www.internationalviewpoint.org/spip.php?article1407/respect_cc.php|title=The SWP’s ever-increasing welter of allegations and distortions|author=Alan Thornett, Respect National Council Member|date=2008-01-01}}
+The SWP has attributed the split within Respect to a shift to the right by George Galloway and his allies, motivated by electoralism (placing election-winning above other principles). This, say the SWP leadership, led to attacks on the SWP as the most prominent left group in Respect.{{cite web|url=http://www.swp.org.uk/respect_cc.php|title=The record: The Socialist Workers Party and Respect|author=SWP Central Committee Statement|date=2007-11-03|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080907150924/http://www.swp.org.uk/respect_cc.php|archivedate=2008-09-07|deadurl=yes}} This interpretation of events is countered by Respect Renewal, which criticises the SWP for opportunism and lack of democracy.{{cite web|url=http://www.internationalviewpoint.org/spip.php?article1407/respect_cc.php|title=The SWP’s ever-increasing welter of allegations and distortions|author=Alan Thornett, Respect National Council Member|date=2008-01-01}}

@@ -43,7 +43,7 @@\n

==Christianity==
[[File:SANGUIS-Brvgensis MGR Zacchaeus Okoth.jpg|thumb|Mgr Okoth]]
-Roman Catholicism was first brought to [[Kenya]] in the fifteenth century by the [[Portugal|Portuguese]], and was spread rapidly during the 20th century by colonists. Today, the main Christian denominations in Kenya are [[Protestant]] confessions, which make up about 47.4% of the country's religious composition.Wycliffe Ambetsa Oparanya (31 August 2010) {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130810185221/http://www.knbs.or.ke/docs/PresentationbyMinisterforPlanningrevised.pdf |date=August 10, 2013 |title=2009 Population & Housing Census Results }}. Ministry of State for Planning. knbs.or.ke They include the [[Anglican Church of Kenya]], and the [[Presbyterianism|Presbyterian]], [[Reformed churches|Reformed]], [[Methodist]], [[Baptists|Baptist]], [[Lutheranism|Lutheran]], and [[Pentecostalism|Pentecostal]] churches. The [[Roman Catholicism in Kenya|Roman Catholic Church]] represents 23.3% of the population. Other statistically significant non-Catholic and non-Protestant movements include the [[Eastern Orthodox Church]], [[New Apostolic Church]], [[Seventh-day Adventist Church]], [[Jehovah's Witnesses]], [[United Pentecostal Church International]], and [[Branhamism]]. The non-Protestant and non-Catholic groups make up about 11.8% of the population.
+Roman Catholicism was first brought to [[Kenya]] in the fifteenth century by the [[Portugal|Portuguese]], and was spread rapidly during the 20th century by colonists. Today, the main Christian denominations in Kenya are [[Protestant]] confessions, which make up about 47.4% of the country's religious composition.Wycliffe Ambetsa Oparanya (31 August 2010) {{Wayback |df=yes|date=20130810185221 |url=http://www.knbs.or.ke/docs/PresentationbyMinisterforPlanningrevised.pdf |title=2009 Population & Housing Census Results }}. Ministry of State for Planning. knbs.or.ke They include the [[Anglican Church of Kenya]], and the [[Presbyterianism|Presbyterian]], [[Reformed churches|Reformed]], [[Methodist]], [[Baptists|Baptist]], [[Lutheranism|Lutheran]], and [[Pentecostalism|Pentecostal]] churches. The [[Roman Catholicism in Kenya|Roman Catholic Church]] represents 23.3% of the population. Other statistically significant non-Catholic and non-Protestant movements include the [[Eastern Orthodox Church]], [[New Apostolic Church]], [[Seventh-day Adventist Church]], [[Jehovah's Witnesses]], [[United Pentecostal Church International]], and [[Branhamism]]. The non-Protestant and non-Catholic groups make up about 11.8% of the population.

[[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Kenya|The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] has more than 10,000 members in 39 congregations in Kenya.{{citation |url= http://www.mormonnewsroom.co.ke/facts-and-statistics/ |contribution= Kenya |title= Facts and Statistics |work= Newsroom |publisher= LDS Church |date= 1 January 2012 |accessdate= 2013-03-09 }} They also have 2 family history centres in Kenya, and an employment resource center in Nairobi.[http://www.lds.org/rcmaps/#ll=-1.561923,38.129361&z=7&m=google.road&layers=meetinghouse,employmentcenter,familysearchcenter&tools=layers&expand=1 LDS Meetinghouse Locator].Latter Day Saint Facilities.

+'''Jumirim''' is a [[Municipalities of Brazil|municipality]] in the state of [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]] in [[Brazil]]. It is part of the [[Metropolitan Region of Sorocaba]].{{Wayback |url=http://www.legislacao.sp.gov.br/legislacao/dg280202.nsf/69aaa17c14b8cb5483256cfb0050146e/399ae95c2cf6d39583257cd30043511f?OpenDocument |title=Governo do Estado de São Paulo, Lei Complementar nº 1.241, de 8 de maio de 2014|date=20141018195931 |df=yes }} The population is 3,142 (2015 est.) in an area of 56.69 km².[http://cod.ibge.gov.br/23E6F Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatística] The elevation is 561 m.

@@ -12,7 +12,7 @@\n

In 1996, Cooper left for Dubai to become the launch editor for Gulf Business magazine of [[Motivate Publishing]]. He returned briefly in 1999 only to write his first book [http://www.amazon.com/Building-Relationships-Hb-Peter-Cooper/dp/029782533X/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1315388476&sr=1-1 Building Relationships], The History of [[Bovis Lend Lease|Bovis]] 1885-2000 whose chairman—the late Sir [[Frank Lampl]] a concentration camp survivor—Cooper greatly respected and later came to know as a friend.

-On a round-the-world trip in late 1999 he noted the success of a financial website in Australia and came back to [[Dubai]] to promote the idea. This became a news and business information website that attracted [[HSBC]] Private Equity Middle East as a significant shareholder in March 2005. In July 2006 the website was wholly acquired by [[Emap]] plc for a total of $27 million.[http://www.ameinfo.com/90609.html ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110810074818/http://www.ameinfo.com/90609.html |date=August 10, 2011 }}
+On a round-the-world trip in late 1999 he noted the success of a financial website in Australia and came back to [[Dubai]] to promote the idea. This became a news and business information website that attracted [[HSBC]] Private Equity Middle East as a significant shareholder in March 2005. In July 2006 the website was wholly acquired by [[Emap]] plc for a total of $27 million.[http://www.ameinfo.com/90609.html ] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.ameinfo.com/90609.html |date=20110810074818 }}

Cooper launched his financial comment website www.arabianmoney.net in 2010 and the pioneering investment newsletter ArabianMoney. Both closed in 2015 as he wrongly judged the business dynamics of the Internet. In 2008 he published his second book [http://www.amazon.com/Opportunity-Dubai-Making-Fortune-Middle/dp/1905641974/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1315388347&sr=8-1 Opportunity Dubai], and his third [http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss?url=search-alias%3Dstripbooks&field-keywords=dubai+sabbatical&x=0&y=0 Dubai Sabbatical] in 2010.

@@ -46,7 +46,7 @@\n

==Rugby career==
[[File:Barbarians FC April 1891.jpg|thumb|left|Hancock with the first touring Barbarians. Hancock is back row, 2nd from right, with hat.]]
-Hancock began playing rugby for local club, Wiveliscombe,{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080807181301/http://www.wiveliscomberugby.co.uk/History.htm |date=August 7, 2008 |title=Wiveliscombe R.F.C. – History }} before playing for first class English side Richmond. In 1886 Hancock was selected for his first international game, when he was selected to represent England against Wales in the [[1886 Home Nations Championship]]. He was reselected for the very next match against [[Ireland national rugby union team|Ireland]] at [[Lansdowne Road]], but missed the final game, the Championship decider, against Scotland. The 1886 Championship also saw the last international match for Hancock's brother, Frank, who had moved to [[Wales]] and represented the [[Wales national rugby union team|Welsh team]]. Frank missed the game against England which would have seen the brothers face each other, but was captain of the Welsh side that faced Scotland seven days later. Hancock played one final game for England, four years later, in the [[1890 Home Nations Championship|1890 Championship]]. This game saw the reintroduction of England after two years away from the international scene, and resulted in the country's first defeat to Wales.
+Hancock began playing rugby for local club, Wiveliscombe,{{Wayback |df=yes|date=20080807181301 |url=http://www.wiveliscomberugby.co.uk/History.htm |title=Wiveliscombe R.F.C. – History }} before playing for first class English side Richmond. In 1886 Hancock was selected for his first international game, when he was selected to represent England against Wales in the [[1886 Home Nations Championship]]. He was reselected for the very next match against [[Ireland national rugby union team|Ireland]] at [[Lansdowne Road]], but missed the final game, the Championship decider, against Scotland. The 1886 Championship also saw the last international match for Hancock's brother, Frank, who had moved to [[Wales]] and represented the [[Wales national rugby union team|Welsh team]]. Frank missed the game against England which would have seen the brothers face each other, but was captain of the Welsh side that faced Scotland seven days later. Hancock played one final game for England, four years later, in the [[1890 Home Nations Championship|1890 Championship]]. This game saw the reintroduction of England after two years away from the international scene, and resulted in the country's first defeat to Wales.

In 1890, Hancock became an original member of [[William Percy Carpmael]]'s newly formed invitational tourists, [[Barbarian F.C.|the Barbarians]], becoming one of the few early members not to have a university background. Hancock went on several Easter tours with the Barbarians, scoring a try against [[Norman Biggs]]' [[Cardiff RFC|Cardiff]] team in 1893.

==Death==

-In February 2008 it was revealed that Carlos Hugo was being treated for [[cancer]]. On 2 August 2010, he announced, via his official website, that his health was further deteriorating.{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050205075220/http://www.borbon-parma.net/Actualidad/actualidad.htm |date=February 5, 2005 |title=News of the House of Parma (in Spanish) }}. borbon-parma.net He died on 18 August 2010 in [[Barcelona]] at the age of 80. Carlos Hugo's remains were taken from Barcelona to [[The Hague]] and laid in state for family members and close relatives in the Fagel Dome on the estate of the [[Noordeinde Palace]] (one of the four official palaces of the [[Dutch royal family]]). On 28 August, the body was transported to [[Parma]] in Italy and interred in the crypt of the [[Sanctuary of Santa Maria della Steccata]].[http://members3.boardhost.com/Beneluxroyal/msg/1282122773.html Prince Carlos-Hugo 2010 – arrangements] – The Benelux Royals Message Board[http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/article20877910.ece Lichaam prins Carlos vrijdag naar Nederland]. telegraaf.nl. 18 August 2010 ''(Dutch)''
+In February 2008 it was revealed that Carlos Hugo was being treated for [[cancer]]. On 2 August 2010, he announced, via his official website, that his health was further deteriorating.{{Wayback |df=yes|date=20050205075220 |url=http://www.borbon-parma.net/Actualidad/actualidad.htm |title=News of the House of Parma (in Spanish)}}. borbon-parma.net He died on 18 August 2010 in [[Barcelona]] at the age of 80. Carlos Hugo's remains were taken from Barcelona to [[The Hague]] and laid in state for family members and close relatives in the Fagel Dome on the estate of the [[Noordeinde Palace]] (one of the four official palaces of the [[Dutch royal family]]). On 28 August, the body was transported to [[Parma]] in Italy and interred in the crypt of the [[Sanctuary of Santa Maria della Steccata]].[http://members3.boardhost.com/Beneluxroyal/msg/1282122773.html Prince Carlos-Hugo 2010 – arrangements] – The Benelux Royals Message Board[http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/article20877910.ece Lichaam prins Carlos vrijdag naar Nederland]. telegraaf.nl. 18 August 2010 ''(Dutch)''

===1964–65: Rise to fame===
[[File:Donovan (1965).jpg|thumb|left|Donovan (1965)]]
-Returning to [[Hatfield, Hertfordshire|Hatfield]], he spent several months playing in local clubs, absorbing the folk scene around his home in [[St Albans]], learning the [[Fingerpicking|crosspicking]] guitar technique from local players such as [[Mac MacLeod]] and [[Mick Softley]] and writing his first songs. In 1964, he travelled to [[Manchester]] with [[Gyp Mills|Gypsy Dave]], then spent the summer in [[Torquay]], Devon. In Torquay he stayed with Mac MacLeod and took up [[busking]], studying the guitar, and learning [[traditional music|traditional]] folk and blues.{{cite web|last=Dixon|first=Kevin|url=http://www.peoplesrepublicofsouthdevon.co.uk/2010/07/17/torquays-other-history-the-inspiration-of-folk-superstars-donovan-and-mac-macleod|title=Torquay's other history: the inspiration of folk superstars Donovan and Mac Macleod|publisher=Peoplesrepublicofsouthdevon.co.uk|date=17 July 2010|accessdate=18 May 2011}}{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090430165209/http://www.macmacleod.co.uk/reviews.html |date=April 30, 2009 |title=reviews }}
+Returning to [[Hatfield, Hertfordshire|Hatfield]], he spent several months playing in local clubs, absorbing the folk scene around his home in [[St Albans]], learning the [[Fingerpicking|crosspicking]] guitar technique from local players such as [[Mac MacLeod]] and [[Mick Softley]] and writing his first songs. In 1964, he travelled to [[Manchester]] with [[Gyp Mills|Gypsy Dave]], then spent the summer in [[Torquay]], Devon. In Torquay he stayed with Mac MacLeod and took up [[busking]], studying the guitar, and learning [[traditional music|traditional]] folk and blues.{{cite web|last=Dixon|first=Kevin|url=http://www.peoplesrepublicofsouthdevon.co.uk/2010/07/17/torquays-other-history-the-inspiration-of-folk-superstars-donovan-and-mac-macleod|title=Torquay's other history: the inspiration of folk superstars Donovan and Mac Macleod|publisher=Peoplesrepublicofsouthdevon.co.uk|date=17 July 2010|accessdate=18 May 2011}}{{Wayback |df=yes|date=20090430165209 |url=http://www.macmacleod.co.uk/reviews.html |title=reviews}}

In late 1964, he was offered a management and publishing contract by [[Peter Eden]] and [[Geoff Stephens]] of [[Pye Records]] in London, for which he recorded a 10-track [[demo tape]] (later released on [[iTunes]]), which included the original of his first single, "[[Catch the Wind]]", and "[[Josie (Donovan song)|Josie]]". The first song revealed the influence of [[Woody Guthrie]] and [[Ramblin' Jack Elliott]], who had also influenced [[Bob Dylan]]. Dylan comparisons followed for some time.{{Gilliland|url=http://digital.library.unt.edu/ark:/67531/metadc19823/m1 |title=Show 48 – The British are Coming! The British are Coming!: With an emphasis on Donovan, the Bee Gees and the Who. [Part 5] |accessdate=18 May 2011}} In an interview with [[KFOK-LP|KFOK]] radio in the US on 14 June 2005, MacLeod said: "The press were fond of calling Donovan a Dylan clone as they had both been influenced by the same sources: Ramblin' Jack Elliott, [[Jesse Fuller]], Woody Guthrie, and many more."{{Citation needed|date=February 2013}}

It is part of the [[Metropolitan Region of Sorocaba]].{{Wayback |url=http://www.legislacao.sp.gov.br/legislacao/dg280202.nsf/69aaa17c14b8cb5483256cfb0050146e/399ae95c2cf6d39583257cd30043511f?OpenDocument |title=Governo do Estado de São Paulo, Lei Complementar nº 1.241, de 8 de maio de 2014|date=20141018195931 |df=yes }} The population is 9,836 (2015 est.) in an area of 352.53 km².[http://cod.ibge.gov.br/23BDB Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatística] The elevation is 590 m.

@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@\n
| website = {{URL|www.ricolove.com}}
}}

-'''Richard Preston Butler, Jr.''' (born December 3, 1982), better known by his stage name '''Rico Love''', is an American singer-songwriter, record producer and rapper. He was born in [[New Orleans|New Orleans, Louisiana]], but split his childhood between [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] and New York City's Harlem neighborhood. He attended [[Florida A&M University|Florida A&M]] and, while visiting [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], worked his way into the music industry through connections with [[Usher (singer)|Usher]], who would become Love's mentor. The first song Love ever wrote in his career was "Throwback" for which ended up on Usher's 2004 album "[[Confessions (Usher album)|''Confessions'']]." Love success continued writing and producing hit records such as Usher's "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]" and "[[Hey Daddy (Daddy's Home)]]", [[Nelly]]'s "[[Just a Dream (Nelly song)|Just a Dream]]" and "[[Gone (Nelly song)|Gone]]", as well as [[Beyoncé Knowles]]' "[[Sweet Dreams (Beyoncé Knowles song)|Sweet Dreams]]".http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=705878http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=702982{{cite web|url=http://www.sesac.com/News/Article.aspx/2010/Summer/Rico%20Love |title=Rico Love |publisher=SESAC |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and has contributed to works which have gone on to win [[Grammy Award|Grammys]] such as Beyoncé's 2009 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[I Am... Sasha Fierce]]'',https://web.archive.org/web/20120503164723/http://www.grammy.com/nominees/search?artist=beyonce&title=&year=All&genre=All Usher's 2010 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[Raymond v. Raymond]]'', and Usher's 2010 Best Male R&B Vocal Performance "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]". In addition Love has written and produced records for [[Kelly Rowland]],{{cite web|url=http://www.starobserver.com.au/celebrity-2/2011/03/09/nelly-and-kelly-reunite/46788 |title=Nelly and Kelly reunite |work=Star Observer |date=March 9, 2011 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Diddy – Dirty Money]],{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/04/28/rico-love-says-diddy-dirty-money-album-will-be-worth-the-wait/ |title=Rico Love Says Diddy-Dirty Money Album Will Be Worth the Wait |publisher=Rap-Up.com |date=April 28, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Chris Brown (American entertainer)|Chris Brown]],{{cite web|url=http://neonlimelight.com/2010/07/09/exclusive-songwriter-rico-love-talks-chris-browns-amazing-songwriting-progress/ |title=Exclusive: Songwriter Rico Love Talks Chris Brown’s "Amazing" Songwriting Progress |publisher=Neonlimelight.com |date=July 9, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Alexandra Burke]], [[Keri Hilson]],{{cite web|url=http://theurbandaily.com/music/shamika-sanders/beyonces-songwriter-rico-love-the-music-business-is-like-high-school/ |title=Rico Love: The Music Industry Is Like High School |publisher=The Urban Daily |date=June 8, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]],{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/fergie-has-sex-and-the-citys-theme-labels-or-love-57108997.html |title=Fergie Has Sex and the City's Theme, 'Labels Or Love' |date=May 5, 2008 |location=California |publisher=Prnewswire.com |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and [[Fantasia Barrino|Fantasia]].http://thatgrapejuice.net/2010/05/rico-love-talks-fantasias-album-wanted-show-people-seductive-side/
+'''Richard Preston Butler, Jr.''' (born December 3, 1982), better known by his stage name '''Rico Love''', is an American singer-songwriter, record producer and rapper. He was born in [[New Orleans|New Orleans, Louisiana]], but split his childhood between [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] and New York City's Harlem neighborhood. He attended [[Florida A&M University|Florida A&M]] and, while visiting [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], worked his way into the music industry through connections with [[Usher (singer)|Usher]], who would become Love's mentor. The first song Love ever wrote in his career was "Throwback" for which ended up on Usher's 2004 album "[[Confessions (Usher album)|''Confessions'']]." Love success continued writing and producing hit records such as Usher's "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]" and "[[Hey Daddy (Daddy's Home)]]", [[Nelly]]'s "[[Just a Dream (Nelly song)|Just a Dream]]" and "[[Gone (Nelly song)|Gone]]", as well as [[Beyoncé Knowles]]' "[[Sweet Dreams (Beyoncé Knowles song)|Sweet Dreams]]".http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=705878http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=702982{{cite web|url=http://www.sesac.com/News/Article.aspx/2010/Summer/Rico%20Love |title=Rico Love |publisher=SESAC |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and has contributed to works which have gone on to win [[Grammy Award|Grammys]] such as Beyoncé's 2009 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[I Am... Sasha Fierce]]'',https://web.archive.org/web/20120503164723/http://www.grammy.com/nominees/search?artist=beyonce&title=&year=All&genre=All Usher's 2010 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[Raymond v. Raymond]]'',[https://web.archive.org/web/20120503164723/http://www.grammy.com/nominees Nominees And Winners | GRAMMY.com] {{WebCite|url=http://www.webcitation.org/5n9wlZGhw|date =January 29, 2010}} and Usher's 2010 Best Male R&B Vocal Performance "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]". In addition Love has written and produced records for [[Kelly Rowland]],{{cite web|url=http://www.starobserver.com.au/celebrity-2/2011/03/09/nelly-and-kelly-reunite/46788 |title=Nelly and Kelly reunite |work=Star Observer |date=March 9, 2011 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Diddy – Dirty Money]],{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/04/28/rico-love-says-diddy-dirty-money-album-will-be-worth-the-wait/ |title=Rico Love Says Diddy-Dirty Money Album Will Be Worth the Wait |publisher=Rap-Up.com |date=April 28, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Chris Brown (American entertainer)|Chris Brown]],{{cite web|url=http://neonlimelight.com/2010/07/09/exclusive-songwriter-rico-love-talks-chris-browns-amazing-songwriting-progress/ |title=Exclusive: Songwriter Rico Love Talks Chris Brown’s "Amazing" Songwriting Progress |publisher=Neonlimelight.com |date=July 9, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Alexandra Burke]], [[Keri Hilson]],{{cite web|url=http://theurbandaily.com/music/shamika-sanders/beyonces-songwriter-rico-love-the-music-business-is-like-high-school/ |title=Rico Love: The Music Industry Is Like High School |publisher=The Urban Daily |date=June 8, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]],{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/fergie-has-sex-and-the-citys-theme-labels-or-love-57108997.html |title=Fergie Has Sex and the City's Theme, 'Labels Or Love' |date=May 5, 2008 |location=California |publisher=Prnewswire.com |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and [[Fantasia Barrino|Fantasia]].http://thatgrapejuice.net/2010/05/rico-love-talks-fantasias-album-wanted-show-people-seductive-side/

Love is also the CEO of Division1, a record label which partnered with [[Interscope Records]] in 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.vibe.com/photo-galleries/rico-love-new-label-division-1-launch-party |title=Rico Love's Division 1/Universal Motown Launch Party |publisher=VIBE |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} Love has appeared as a featured artist on records with [[T.I.]],{{cite web|url=http://rapradar.com/2011/01/26/new-video-t-i-x-rico-love-lay-me-down/ |title=New Video: T.I. x Rico Love "Lay Me Down" |publisher=Rap Radar |date=January 26, 2011 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Usher (singer)|Ushe]]r,{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisrnb.com/2009/12/music-usher-feat-rico-love-shes-got-it/ |title=Music: Usher feat. Rico Love – She’s Got It |publisher=Thisisrnb.com |date=December 2, 2009 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Jermaine Dupri]],{{cite web|url=http://www.last.fm/music/Jermaine+Dupri/_/Gotta%2BGetcha%2B%2528Remix%2529%2B%2528Feat.%2BUsher%2B%2526%2BRico%2BLove%2529 |title=Jermaine Dupri – Gotta Getcha (Remix) (Feat. Usher & Rico Love) – Listening & stats at |publisher=Last.fm |date=February 11, 2009 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Jamie Foxx]],{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=ntt_srch_drd_B004FKJ3PE?ie=UTF8&search-type=ss&index=digital-music&field-keywords=Jamie%20Foxx%20Featuring%20Rico%20Love |title=Jamie Foxx Featuring Rico Love: MP3 Downloads |publisher=Amazon.com |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Rich Boy]],{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphopmusicdotcom.com/rich-boy-ft-rico-love-we-like-it.html |title=Rich Boy ft. 2016-11-14 04:57:19 749410405 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by SilkTork --- \n

@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@\n

There is some controversy over whether fellow ex-Yes member, keyboardist [[Tony Kaye (musician)|Tony Kaye]], who appeared on the first Flash album, was actually an "official" member of the group, or merely a guest. The confusion stems from the fact that Kaye is listed alongside the other members of the group on the back cover. Interviews with all the parties confirm that, though Kaye was invited to join he declined, and should have been cited as a guest on the first album. He went on to found [[Badger (band)|Badger]] in 1972. Other potential keyboard players were approached or auditioned at the time, including Ian McDonald (formerly of [[King Crimson]]), [[Rick Wakeman]] (soon to join Yes) and [[Patrick Moraz]] (also a future member of Yes), but eventually the band decided to carry on as a keyboard-less quartet, with Carter handling the occasional synthesizer part.

-Flash had a minor hit with "Small Beginnings" (1972, No. 29 [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] [[record chart|chart]]) which was featured in the [[film|movie]], ''Record Review''. The song "Small Beginnings" has also been included in numerous [[compilation album]]s, most recently Bob Stroud's ''Rock 'n Roll Roots, Vol. 10''.[http://www.wdrv.com/roots10.php?bob=1 Wdrv.com] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081030014452/http://www.wdrv.com/roots10.php?bob=1 |date=October 30, 2008 }}
+Flash had a minor hit with "Small Beginnings" (1972, No. 29 [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] [[record chart|chart]]) which was featured in the [[film|movie]], ''Record Review''. The song "Small Beginnings" has also been included in numerous [[compilation album]]s, most recently Bob Stroud's ''Rock 'n Roll Roots, Vol. 10''.[http://www.wdrv.com/roots10.php?bob=1 Wdrv.com] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.wdrv.com/roots10.php?bob=1 |date=20081030014452 }}

The band released three albums, ''Flash'' (1972), ''In The Can'' (1972 Nov.) and ''Out Of Our Hands'' (1973 Summer).

@@ -49,7 +49,7 @@\n

More recently, Bennett and Carter have been working together again under the Flash name (Hough was initially involved but later dropped out, and there was, briefly, talk of Banks taking part but, in the end, Banks fell out again with Bennett and Carter and was excluded).

-Bennett (now on lead guitar) and Carter played together as a duo under the Flash name at the 2005 Baja Prog Festival in [[Mexico]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dmme.net/interviews/bennett.html |title=LET IT ROCK - Ray BENNETT interview |publisher=Dmme.net |date= |accessdate=2012-02-28}}{{cite web|url=http://dmme.net/specials/flash.html |title=LET IT ROCK - Flash At Baja Prog special |publisher=Dmme.net |date=2005-04-02 |accessdate=2012-02-28}}[http://moonjune.com/Roster.htm Moonjune.com] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070214013336/http://moonjune.com/Roster.htm |date=February 14, 2007 }}
+Bennett (now on lead guitar) and Carter played together as a duo under the Flash name at the 2005 Baja Prog Festival in [[Mexico]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dmme.net/interviews/bennett.html |title=LET IT ROCK - Ray BENNETT interview |publisher=Dmme.net |date= |accessdate=2012-02-28}}{{cite web|url=http://dmme.net/specials/flash.html |title=LET IT ROCK - Flash At Baja Prog special |publisher=Dmme.net |date=2005-04-02 |accessdate=2012-02-28}}[http://moonjune.com/Roster.htm Moonjune.com] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://moonjune.com/Roster.htm |date=20070214013336 }}

Bennett and Carter posted new Flash material on the flash/bennettcarter MySpace website in July, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.myspace.com/flashbennettcarter |title=FLASH | Gratis muziek, tourneedata, foto's, video's |publisher=Myspace.com |date=2008-01-13 |accessdate=2012-02-28}} Titles of the new songs are "Grand Canyon," "How The West Was Won" (later changed to "Into the "Sun") and "10,000". Videos of the reunited Flash can be found on YouTube.

@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@\n

'''Admington''' is a village and [[civil parish]] in the [[Stratford-on-Avon (district)|Stratford-on-Avon]] district of the [[England|English]] county of [[Warwickshire]]. It is known as '''Edelmintone''' in the ''[[Domesday Book]]''. The name Admington means 'estate associated with a man called Æthelhelm'.[http://www.encyclopedia.com/doc/1O40-Admington.html Dictionary Definition - Admington] In the [[United Kingdom Census 2001|2001 census]] the parish had a population of 100. By the time of the 2011 Census population details can be found under [[Quinton, Warwickshire]]. The village is {{convert|1|mi|km}} north-west from [[Ilmington]] and {{convert|4|mi|km}} north-east from [[Chipping Campden]].

-Admington is home to [[Admington Hall]].[http://www.york.ac.uk/depts/arch/landscapes/ukpg/sites/admingto.htm Admington House] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061028015433/http://www.york.ac.uk/depts/arch/landscapes/ukpg/sites/admingto.htm |date=28 October 2006 }}
+Admington is home to [[Admington Hall]].[http://www.york.ac.uk/depts/arch/landscapes/ukpg/sites/admingto.htm Admington House] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.york.ac.uk/depts/arch/landscapes/ukpg/sites/admingto.htm |date=20061028015433 }}
 There is a village hall also, but this is located in [[Quinton, Warwickshire|Quinton]] and shared with Admington.

==References==

==Battle honours==
[[File:RA Distinction.png|right|thumb|Honorary Distinction awarded to the [[Shropshire Yeomanry]] for service as a Royal Artillery regiment. The Rough Riders Honorary Distinction would be similar.]]
-The City of London Yeomanry was awarded the following [[battle honour]]s:{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20051226171435/http://regiments.org/regiments/uk/volmil-london/vcav/LonRR.htm |date=December 26, 2005 |title=The City of London Yeomanry (Rough Riders) at regiments.org by T.F.Mills }}
+The City of London Yeomanry was awarded the following [[battle honour]]s:{{Wayback | url=http://regiments.org/regiments/uk/volmil-london/vcav/LonRR.htm | title=The City of London Yeomanry (Rough Riders) at regiments.org by T.F.Mills | date=20051226171435 | df=yes }}
;Second Boer War
[[South Africa 1900–02]]
;World War I
[[Hundred Days' Offensive|Pursuit to Mons]], [[Western Front (World War I)|France and Flanders 1918]], [[Macedonian front|Macedonia 1916–17]], [[Landing at Suvla Bay|Suvla]], [[Battle of Scimitar Hill|Scimitar Hill]], [[Gallipoli Campaign|Gallipoli 1915]], [[Battle of Romani|Rumani]], [[Sinai and Palestine Campaign|Egypt 1915–16]], [[Gaza (Battle honour)|Gaza]], [[Battle of Mughar Ridge|El Mughar]], [[Battle of Nebi Samwil|Nebi Samwil]], [[Sinai and Palestine Campaign|Palestine 1917–18]]
;World War II
-The Royal Artillery was present in nearly all battles and would have earned most of the honours awarded to cavalry and infantry regiments. In 1833, [[William IV of the United Kingdom|William IV]] awarded the motto ''Ubique'' (meaning "everywhere") in place of all battle honours.{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070715140005/http://regiments.org/regiments/uk/art-eng-sig/RA.htm |date=July 15, 2007 |title=Royal Regiment of Artillery at regiments.org by T.F.Mills }}
+The Royal Artillery was present in nearly all battles and would have earned most of the honours awarded to cavalry and infantry regiments. In 1833, [[William IV of the United Kingdom|William IV]] awarded the motto ''Ubique'' (meaning "everywhere") in place of all battle honours.{{Wayback | url=http://regiments.org/regiments/uk/art-eng-sig/RA.htm | title=Royal Regiment of Artillery at regiments.org by T.F.Mills | date=20070715140005 | df=yes }}

[[Battle honours of the British and Imperial Armies#Territorial Army honorary distinctions of the Second World War|Honorary Distinction]]: Badge of the Royal Regiment of Artillery with year-dates "1942–45" and two scrolls: "[[North African Campaign|North Africa]]" and "[[Italian Campaign (World War II)|Italy]]"

2016-11-14 05:02:54 749411097 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by Everyking --- \n
