@@ -2,14 +2,14 @@\n
{{Main|Polish Righteous among the Nations}}
'''Irena Adamowicz''' (11 May 1910 – 12 August 1973), was a Polish-born scout leader and a Resistance worker during World War II.

-Adamowicz was born in [[Warsaw]], to a [[Szlachta|Polish noble family]] and held a degree in [[social work]] from the [[University of Warsaw]] before World War II.[http://www.sprawiedliwi.org.pl/pl/family/421,adamowicz-irena/ Irena Adamowicz: Sprawiedliwy wśród Narodów Świata.] MHŻP, Warsaw. She served as one of the leaders of the [[Polish Scouting Association|Polish Scout movement]] (''Harcerz Polski'') coordinating its activities as a Senior Girl Scout. A Polish [[Roman Catholicism|Roman Catholic]], Adamowicz provided counseling and educational services not only for the Catholic Scouts, but also for the Jewish youth movement called [[Hashomer Hatzair]] (Ha-Shomer ha-Tsa'ir) in the 1930s, working in close co-operation with [[Arie Wilner]].[[Anna Poray]], {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080206114319/http://www.savingjews.org/righteous/av.htm |date=February 6, 2008 |title=Polish Righteous, Those Who Risked Their Lives; Irena Adamowicz }} 2004.
+Adamowicz was born in [[Warsaw]], to a [[Szlachta|Polish noble family]] and held a degree in [[social work]] from the [[University of Warsaw]] before World War II.[http://www.sprawiedliwi.org.pl/pl/family/421,adamowicz-irena/ Irena Adamowicz: Sprawiedliwy wśród Narodów Świata.] MHŻP, Warsaw. She served as one of the leaders of the [[Polish Scouting Association|Polish Scout movement]] (''Harcerz Polski'') coordinating its activities as a Senior Girl Scout. A Polish [[Roman Catholicism|Roman Catholic]], Adamowicz provided counseling and educational services not only for the Catholic Scouts, but also for the Jewish youth movement called [[Hashomer Hatzair]] (Ha-Shomer ha-Tsa'ir) in the 1930s, working in close co-operation with [[Arie Wilner]].[[Anna Poray]], {{Wayback |df=yes|date=20080206114319 |url=http://www.savingjews.org/righteous/av.htm |title=Polish Righteous, Those Who Risked Their Lives; Irena Adamowicz }} 2004.

Following the [[Invasion of Poland (1939)|Nazi German invasion of Poland]], Adamowicz became a member of the underground [[Home Army]] (''Armia Krajowa'') as a clandestine courier. She delivered messages and provided aid and moral support for the Jewish ghettos in several distant cities.

In 1985, Adamowicz was posthumously bestowed the title of the [[Righteous Among the Nations]] by [[Yad Vashem]] in Jerusalem for her heroic stand against the German Nazi [[Holocaust]].Shoah Resource Center, The International School for Holocaust Studies, [http://www1.yadvashem.org/odot_pdf/Microsoft%20Word%20-%205717.pdf Adamowicz, Irena] at www.yadvashem.org[http://www1.yadvashem.org/yv/en/righteous/pdf/virtial_wall/poland.pdf Righteous Among the Nations Recognized by Yad Vashem as of 1 January 2010. (pdf 1.55MB)] Note: ''the direct link changed at source with YV annual update, search [http://www.google.ca/#hl=en&source=hp&biw=1016&bih=732&q=yadvashem.org%2Fpoland.pdf&btnG=Google+Search&aq=f&aqi=&aql=&oq=&gs_rfai=&fp=a68c71f74e14387b yadvashem.org/poland.pdf] if present link discontinued''

==Liaison missions==
-Due to her work for both, Polish and Jewish youth before the invasion of Poland, and her close contact with the Jewish Zionist movement, Adamowicz, a devout Christian, was able to come to the aid of [[Jewish Fighting Organization]]'s efforts to establish a channel of communication between the ghettos of different cities. At a meeting in Warsaw in late 1941 a decision was made to embark on this perilous effort, by the representatives of [[Armia Krajowa|AK]] including Irena Adamowicz and Stanislaw Hajduk, and, on the Jewish side, by [[Mordechaj Anielewicz]], [[Icchak Cukierman]], Josef Kaplan and [[Cywia Lubetkin]]. Throughout the summer of 1942 Adamowicz went on a daring trip across Poland and [[Lithuania]] to establish contact between clandestine organizations in the ghettos of Warsaw, Wilno (now [[Vilnius]]), [[Białystok]], Kovno (now [[Kaunas]]) and Shavle ([[Šiauliai]]). Her visits became a source of both vital information and moral encouragement, such as her inspirational presence in [[Kovno Ghetto]] in July 1942. She earned a Jewish nickname "Di chalutzishe [[shiksa|shikse]]", the Pioneering Gentile.Abraham J. Edelheit, Hershel Edelheit, ''History of the Holocaust''; [http://books.google.ca/books?id=ilnACY97x4kC&pg=PA218&lpg=PA218&dq=Irena+Adamowicz+Righteous&source=web&ots=YZqbRUVb5i&sig=G6AhrbVf5c8olDnkra7pS5P8XVM&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=9&ct=result Irena Adamowicz: Di chalutzishe shikse]{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080513025331/http://www.marchoftheliving.org/mol2008/08readings.html |date=May 13, 2008 |title=March of the Living Canada 2008 }}[http://www.eilatgordinlevitan.com/kovno/kovno_pages/kovno_right.html Kovno Righteous Gentiles]Yitzhak Zuckerman, Barbara Harshav, [http://books.google.ca/books?id=5_Ea_8g3X_oC&pg=PA493&dq=%22Irena+Adamowicz,+who+helped+Jews+deliberately+and+consciously%22&sig=ACfU3U3N21aOUIuXGu_7vsI2tAlM_sMivQ A Surplus of Memory: Chronicle of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising p. 493] 1993 University of California Press, 702 pages, ISBN 0-520-07841-1[http://www1.yadvashem.org/about_holocaust/month_in_holocaust/august/august_lexicon/kovno.html Month in Holocaust: August] 2004 Yad Vashem The Holocaust Martyrs' and Heroes' Remembrance Authority
+Due to her work for both, Polish and Jewish youth before the invasion of Poland, and her close contact with the Jewish Zionist movement, Adamowicz, a devout Christian, was able to come to the aid of [[Jewish Fighting Organization]]'s efforts to establish a channel of communication between the ghettos of different cities. At a meeting in Warsaw in late 1941 a decision was made to embark on this perilous effort, by the representatives of [[Armia Krajowa|AK]] including Irena Adamowicz and Stanislaw Hajduk, and, on the Jewish side, by [[Mordechaj Anielewicz]], [[Icchak Cukierman]], Josef Kaplan and [[Cywia Lubetkin]]. Throughout the summer of 1942 Adamowicz went on a daring trip across Poland and [[Lithuania]] to establish contact between clandestine organizations in the ghettos of Warsaw, Wilno (now [[Vilnius]]), [[Białystok]], Kovno (now [[Kaunas]]) and Shavle ([[Šiauliai]]). Her visits became a source of both vital information and moral encouragement, such as her inspirational presence in [[Kovno Ghetto]] in July 1942. She earned a Jewish nickname "Di chalutzishe [[shiksa|shikse]]", the Pioneering Gentile.Abraham J. Edelheit, Hershel Edelheit, ''History of the Holocaust''; [http://books.google.ca/books?id=ilnACY97x4kC&pg=PA218&lpg=PA218&dq=Irena+Adamowicz+Righteous&source=web&ots=YZqbRUVb5i&sig=G6AhrbVf5c8olDnkra7pS5P8XVM&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=9&ct=result Irena Adamowicz: Di chalutzishe shikse]{{Wayback |df=yes|date=20080513025331 |url=http://www.marchoftheliving.org/mol2008/08readings.html |title=March of the Living Canada 2008 }}[http://www.eilatgordinlevitan.com/kovno/kovno_pages/kovno_right.html Kovno Righteous Gentiles]Yitzhak Zuckerman, Barbara Harshav, [http://books.google.ca/books?id=5_Ea_8g3X_oC&pg=PA493&dq=%22Irena+Adamowicz,+who+helped+Jews+deliberately+and+consciously%22&sig=ACfU3U3N21aOUIuXGu_7vsI2tAlM_sMivQ A Surplus of Memory: Chronicle of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising p. 493] 1993 University of California Press, 702 pages, ISBN 0-520-07841-1[http://www1.yadvashem.org/about_holocaust/month_in_holocaust/august/august_lexicon/kovno.html Month in Holocaust: August] 2004 Yad Vashem The Holocaust Martyrs' and Heroes' Remembrance Authority

Following the end of World War II, Adamowicz remained in close contact with the survivors of the Holocaust, with whom she had worked in the Jewish underground. Thanks to their efforts, she was named Righteous among the Nations in 1985. Her personal experience became a part of the book by [[Władysław Bartoszewski|Bartoszewski]] and [[Zofia Lewin|Lewin]] entitled ''Righteous Among Nations; How Poles Helped the Jews, 1939–1945.''Bartoszewski & Lewin, ''Righteous Among Nations; How Poles Helped the Jews, 1939–1945''. London, Earlscourt Publications Ltd, 1969. (lxxxvii, 834) Includes first-person testimony by Adamowicz. ASIN: B000NUN16CHolocaust Survivors and Remembrance Project: "Forget You Not", [http://isurvived.org/TOC-II.html Irena Adamowicz] Holocaust Remembrance, Sanctuary, and Beyond ...

== Integrals containing both [[sine]] and [[cotangent]] ==
2016-11-14 05:02:29 749411034 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by AnomieBOT --- \n

@@ -27,7 +27,7 @@\n

Freedom of the press in Belarus remains extremely restricted. State-owned media are subordinated to the president and harassment and censorship of independent media are routine. The government subjects both independent and foreign media to systematic political intimidation, especially for reporting on the deteriorating economy and human rights abuses. Journalists are harassed and detained for reporting on unauthorized demonstrations or working with unregistered media outlets. Journalists have been killed in suspicious circumstances.[http://blog.indexoncensorship.org/2010/09/08/europes-shame-the-dictatorship-of-belarus/ "The death of Oleg Bebenin"], Michael Harris, Index on Censorship, 4 September 2010 Most local independent outlets regularly practice [[self-censorship]].

-[[Reporters Without Borders]] ranked [[Belarus]] 154th out of 178 countries in its 2010 [[Press Freedom Index]].[http://en.rsf.org/press-freedom-index-2010,1034.html ''Press Freedom Index 2010''] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101124000000/http://en.rsf.org/press-freedom-index-2010,1034.html |date=24 November 2010 }}, Reporters Without Borders, 20 October 2010
+[[Reporters Without Borders]] ranked [[Belarus]] 154th out of 178 countries in its 2010 [[Press Freedom Index]].[http://en.rsf.org/press-freedom-index-2010,1034.html ''Press Freedom Index 2010''] {{wayback|url=http://en.rsf.org/press-freedom-index-2010,1034.html |date=20101124000000 |df=y }}, Reporters Without Borders, 20 October 2010
In the 2011 [[Freedom House]] ''[[Freedom of the Press (report)|Freedom of the Press report]]'', Belarus scored 92 on a scale from 10 (most free) to 99 (least free), because the [[Aleksandr Lukashenko|Lukashenko]] regime systematically curtails press freedom. This score placed Belarus 9th from the bottom of the 196 countries included in the report and earned the country a "Not Free" status.[http://www.freedomhouse.org/template.cfm?page=251&year=2010 "Country report: Belarus"], ''Freedom of the Press 2011'', Freedom House, 21 April 2011

==Media outlets==
@@ -58,7 +58,7 @@\n

Among the [[Belarusian language|Belarus-language]] newspapers, the main and state-controlled one is ''[[Zviazda]]'' (Звязда, 40,000 copies). Other newspapers include ''[[Novy Chas]]'' (Новы Час, 7,000 copies{{cite web|url=http://freemogilev.info/news/2-navinybelarus/275-q-xxi------q.html |title=Freemogilev Resources and Information|publisher=Freemogilev|accessdate=13 August 2014}}), ''[[Nasha Slova]]'' (Наша Слова, 7,000 copies, newspaper about culture and history, published by the [[Belarusian Language Society|Francishak Skaryna Belarusian Language Society]]), ''[[Naša Niva]]'' (Наша Ніва; 6,000 copies, the oldest Belarusian weekly newspaper founded in 1906 and revived in 1991, pro-opposition), and ''[[Holas Radzimy]]'' (Голас радзiмы, 2,000 copies{{cite web|url=http://house.gov.by/index.php/,1,20395,1,,0,0,0.html |title=Палата представителей Национального собрания Республики Беларусь:|publisher=Government|accessdate=13 August 2014}}), government-controlled newspaper for the Belarusian diaspora. Regional dailies include the online [[Vitsebsk]] newspaper ''[[Narodnya Naviny Vitsebska]]'' (Народныя навіны Віцебска) as well as ''[[Pahonia (newspaper)|Pahonia]]'' (Пагоня), a pro-opposition newspaper formerly published in [[Hrodna]], only published online since being closed down by the government in 2001.

-Among the [[Russian language|Russian-language]] newspapers, the largest national newspaper is ''[[Sovetskaya Belorussia]]'' (Советская Белоруссия; over 500,000 copies), official newspaper of the Administration of the [[President of Belarus]]. Other dailies include ''[[Respublika (Belarusian newspaper)|Respublika]]'' (Рэспубліка; 119,500 copies[http://news.belta.by/ru/bel/smi/11 ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070212053507/http://news.belta.by/ru/bel/smi/11 |date=February 12, 2007 }}), official newspaper of the [[Government of Belarus]]; ''[[Vo Slavu Rodiny]]'' (Во славу Родины; 32,300 copies[http://www.president.gov.by/press38695.html ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101128095857/http://www.president.gov.by/press38695.html |date=November 28, 2010 }}), official newspaper of the [[Belarusian Ministry of Defense]]; ''[[Narodnaya Gazeta]]'' (Народная Газета, 25,042 copies), official newspaper of the [[Parliament of Belarus]]; ''[[BelGazeta]]'' (БелГазета, 21,200 copies[http://www.belgazeta.by/reklama/ ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090617193558/http://www.belgazeta.by/reklama/ |date=June 17, 2009 }}), independent national newspaper on business and politics; ''[[Belorusy i rynok]]'' (Белорусы и Рынок, 12,000 copies{{cite web|url=http://indar.by/client/partners.php?lim=10&limstart=10 |title=Наши партнеры: газета Из рук в руки, Автобизнес, Аиф, журнал Стройка, Цены и товары, Автогазета, Комсомольская правда в Белоруссии, Авто Из рук в руки, Строительная газета, Моя реклама |publisher=Indar|accessdate=13 August 2014}}) [http://belmarket.by/], weekly independent business newspaper. ''[[Belorusskaya Delovaya Gazeta]]'' (БДГ; BDG), formerly the largest independent newspaper on politics and business in 1990's (with about 70,000 copies), was closed down by officials in 2006.
+Among the [[Russian language|Russian-language]] newspapers, the largest national newspaper is ''[[Sovetskaya Belorussia]]'' (Советская Белоруссия; over 500,000 copies), official newspaper of the Administration of the [[President of Belarus]]. Other dailies include ''[[Respublika (Belarusian newspaper)|Respublika]]'' (Рэспубліка; 119,500 copies[http://news.belta.by/ru/bel/smi/11 ] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://news.belta.by/ru/bel/smi/11 |date=20070212053507 }}), official newspaper of the [[Government of Belarus]]; ''[[Vo Slavu Rodiny]]'' (Во славу Родины; 32,300 copies[http://www.president.gov.by/press38695.html ] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.president.gov.by/press38695.html |date=20101128095857 }}), official newspaper of the [[Belarusian Ministry of Defense]]; ''[[Narodnaya Gazeta]]'' (Народная Газета, 25,042 copies), official newspaper of the [[Parliament of Belarus]]; ''[[BelGazeta]]'' (БелГазета, 21,200 copies[http://www.belgazeta.by/reklama/ ] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.belgazeta.by/reklama/ |date=20090617193558 }}), independent national newspaper on business and politics; ''[[Belorusy i rynok]]'' (Белорусы и Рынок, 12,000 copies{{cite web|url=http://indar.by/client/partners.php?lim=10&limstart=10 |title=Наши партнеры: газета Из рук в руки, Автобизнес, Аиф, журнал Стройка, Цены и товары, Автогазета, Комсомольская правда в Белоруссии, Авто Из рук в руки, Строительная газета, Моя реклама |publisher=Indar|accessdate=13 August 2014}}) [http://belmarket.by/], weekly independent business newspaper. ''[[Belorusskaya Delovaya Gazeta]]'' (БДГ; BDG), formerly the largest independent newspaper on politics and business in 1990's (with about 70,000 copies), was closed down by officials in 2006.

Bilingual Russian/Belorusian newspapers include ''[[Narodnaja Volya (newspaper)|Narodnaja Volia]]'' (Народная воля, 15,000 copies{{cite web|url=http://newsby.org/by/2008/11/25/text2818.htm |script-title=ru:Газета "Народная Воля" появится в киосках на следующей неделе Беларускія навіны|language=ru|publisher=Newsby|date=19 December 2010|accessdate=13 August 2014}}), the largest national pro-opposition newspaper on politics; '' [[Hazeta Slonimskaya]]'' (Газета Слонімская; Газета Слонимская; 7,000 to 8,000 copies{{cite web|url=http://www.gs.by/ru/37/520/ |title=Слонимская газета: новости, происшествия, расписание, реклама, частные объявления города Слоним – Рекламодателям|publisher=GS|accessdate=13 August 2014}}), an independent local newspaper published in '''[[Slonim]]'''; ''[[Intex-Press]]'' (Интекс-пресс, 17,300 copies{{cite web|url=http://intex-press.com/ru/763/300/ |title=Newspaper Resources and Information. |publisher=Intex-Press |accessdate=13 August 2014}}) [http://intex-press.com/], an independent local newspaper published in [[Baranavichy]]; ''[[Zhodzinskiya Naviny]]'' (Жодзінскія Навіны; Zhodino News) [http://www.zhodinonews.h1.ru/] – published in [[Zhodzina]]; ''[[Vecherniy Brest]]'' (Вечерний Брест; Evening Brest) [http://www.vb.by] – published in [[Brest, Belarus|Brest]]
2016-11-14 05:15:14 749412602 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by InternetArchiveBot --- \n
+++ \n
@@ -63,7 +63,7 @@\n
Under the [[Police Act 1964]] and local government reform in 1974, the Isle of Ely Constabulary became part of the present [[Cambridgeshire Constabulary]].[http://www.theera.free-online.co.uk/index.htm Cambridgeshire Constabulary History] The Badgers Lair (retrieved 11 December 2005) A small [[police station]] is situated in East Park Street, but it is no longer open to the public.[http://www.cambs.police.uk/contactus/maps.asp Cambridgeshire Constabulary], URL accessed 17 July 2016

== Geography ==
-Chatteris is situated between Huntingdon, St Ives, Peterborough, March and Ely, in the middle of The Fens—the lowest-lying area in the United Kingdom—with most of the land surrounding the town being below [[sea level]], although the highest point in the Fens (36 feet above sea level) is within Chatteris's parish boundaries.[http://www.malcmoss.easynet.co.uk/landscape.htm Malcolm Moss MP constituency page], URL accessed 8 September 2009 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080801052056/http://www.malcmoss.easynet.co.uk/landscape.htm |date=August 1, 2008 }} The [[peat]]y land surrounding the town is largely used for agriculture, drained by numerous ditches and dykes, and there are two large drainage rivers near the town - the Forty Foot Drain, also known as Vermuyden's Drain, and the Sixteen Foot Drain.[http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=21900 "North Witchford Hundred: Chatteris"], ''A History of the County of Cambridge and the Isle of Ely'': Volume 4: City of Ely; Ely, N. and S. Witchford and Wisbech Hundreds'' (2002), pp. 103-109. URL accessed 8 September 2009.
+Chatteris is situated between Huntingdon, St Ives, Peterborough, March and Ely, in the middle of The Fens—the lowest-lying area in the United Kingdom—with most of the land surrounding the town being below [[sea level]], although the highest point in the Fens (36 feet above sea level) is within Chatteris's parish boundaries.[http://www.malcmoss.easynet.co.uk/landscape.htm Malcolm Moss MP constituency page], URL accessed 8 September 2009 {{Wayback|url=http://www.malcmoss.easynet.co.uk/landscape.htm|date =20080801052056|bot=DASHBot}} The [[peat]]y land surrounding the town is largely used for agriculture, drained by numerous ditches and dykes, and there are two large drainage rivers near the town - the Forty Foot Drain, also known as Vermuyden's Drain, and the Sixteen Foot Drain.[http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=21900 "North Witchford Hundred: Chatteris"], ''A History of the County of Cambridge and the Isle of Ely'': Volume 4: City of Ely; Ely, N. and S. Witchford and Wisbech Hundreds'' (2002), pp. 103-109. URL accessed 8 September 2009.

Chatteris is a key turning point on the [[A141 road]] (known as the Isle of Ely way){{cite map |publisher= |title=Google Maps |url=https://maps.google.com/maps?ll=52.456,0.055&spn=0.1,0.1&t=m&q=52.456,0.055 |edition= |year=2009 |cartography=Tele Atlas |scale= |series= |page= |section= |inset= |accessdate=6 September 2009 |isbn= |id= }} and the starting point of the [[A142 road]] to Ely and Suffolk (known as [[Henry Ireton|Ireton's Way]]{{cite map |publisher= |title=Google Maps |url=https://maps.google.com/maps?q=52.456,0.055&ie=UTF8&ll=52.437909,0.082054&spn=0.037569,0.095358&z=14 |edition= |year=2009 |cartography=Tele Atlas |scale= |series= |page= |section= |inset= |accessdate=6 September 2009 |isbn= |id= }}). The town also has important links to Cambridge and the [[A14 road (England)|A14]] via the B1050 to [[Bar Hill]]. The town centre traffic was bypassed in 1986, with the disused route of the former St Ives extension of the Great Eastern Railway being used to build the A141 to March and [[Guyhirn]].[http://www.fenland.gov.uk/assets/localplan/downloads/part2/Chatteris/Chatteris.pdf Fenland District Wide Local Plan: Chatteris] (Adopted August 1993), Fenland District Council

@@ -97,13 +97,13 @@\n
== Sport and leisure ==
The town's football club, [[Chatteris Town F.C.|Chatteris Town]], was founded in 1920 and currently play in the Kershaw Premier Division of the [[Cambridgeshire Football Association County League]].[http://www.chatteristownfc.co.uk/ Chatteris Town F.C.], URL accessed 21 November 2010 The town also has a [[cricket]] club, Chatteris Cricket Club, which was founded in 1879. The club has five senior teams and four youth teams that compete in both the Fenland and Cambridgeshire leagues. Chatteris CC won the St Ivo Midweek League in 2008 and 2009 going both seasons unbeaten.[http://chatteriscc.play-cricket.com/home/home.asp Chatteris Cricket Club], URL accessed 21 May 2008 The town also has a bowls club and a tennis club (St Peters). Chatteris Airfield is about {{convert|2|km|mi}} north-northeast, which is mainly used for skydiving, and is the base of the North London Skydiving Centre. A flying school is also based at the airfield.[http://ukga.com/airfield/chatteris Chatteris Airfield], URL accessed 21 March 2009[http://ukskydiving.com/location/ North London Parachute Centre], URL accessed 21 March 2009

-The town has one swimming pool, the Empress, which is privately owned and is a registered charity run by three trustees. It is open to members and can be booked for private hires or group sessions.[http://www.empressgroup.co.uk/chatteris/chatteris2.html Chatteris Business Directory], URL accessed 18 May 2008 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070616123850/http://www.empressgroup.co.uk/chatteris/chatteris2.html |date=June 16, 2007 }} It is home of the Chatteris Kingfishers swimming club, who after successes in 2008 compete in Division One of the 2009 "Cambs Cup" competition."[http://www.fenlandcitizen.co.uk/sport/Kingfishers-in-the-top-flight.3911047.jp Kingfishers in the Top Flight]" in the ''Fenland Citizen'', March 2008 Plans for a public swimming pool and leisure centre have been proposed by the council since 1990, but have yet to be approved. Proposals for the development of [[Cromwell Community College]] under the government's BSF programme include significant leisure provisions and these are expected to start in 2010.[http://chatteriscouncil.blogspot.com/ Chatteris Council], URL accessed 18 May 2008[http://www.fenland.gov.uk/assets/localplan/downloads/part2/Chatteris/Chatteris.pdf Fenland District Council], URL accessed 18 May 2008
+The town has one swimming pool, the Empress, which is privately owned and is a registered charity run by three trustees. It is open to members and can be booked for private hires or group sessions.[http://www.empressgroup.co.uk/chatteris/chatteris2.html Chatteris Business Directory], URL accessed 18 May 2008 {{Wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.empressgroup.co.uk/chatteris/chatteris2.html|date =20070616123850|bot=DASHBot}} It is home of the Chatteris Kingfishers swimming club, who after successes in 2008 compete in Division One of the 2009 "Cambs Cup" competition."[http://www.fenlandcitizen.co.uk/sport/Kingfishers-in-the-top-flight.3911047.jp Kingfishers in the Top Flight]" in the ''Fenland Citizen'', March 2008 Plans for a public swimming pool and leisure centre have been proposed by the council since 1990, but have yet to be approved. Proposals for the development of [[Cromwell Community College]] under the government's BSF programme include significant leisure provisions and these are expected to start in 2010.[http://chatteriscouncil.blogspot.com/ Chatteris Council], URL accessed 18 May 2008[http://www.fenland.gov.uk/assets/localplan/downloads/part2/Chatteris/Chatteris.pdf Fenland District Council], URL accessed 18 May 2008
A new gym situated in the grounds of Cromwell Community College opened in 2013.[http://www.newvisionfitness.co.uk/article/8053/The-Chatteris-Centre The Chatteris Centre], New Vision Fitness, URL accessed 17 July 2016

== Culture and community ==
The town is noted for its annual display of [[Christmas lights (holiday decoration)|Christmas lights]], which are entirely funded by community donations and have been featured on [[BBC Look East]].[http://www.chatterischristmaslights.co.uk chatterischristmaslights.co.uk], URL accessed 19 September 2010[http://www.visitthefens.co.uk/exec/132265/13006 Visit the Fens: Chatteris], URL accessed 21 August 2009 In 2008, a medieval-themed Historical Festival replaced the town's traditional festival week.[http://www.fenland.gov.uk/ccm/content/marketing/2008/june-2008---press-releases/chatteris-medieval-festival-set-to-pull-in-the-crowds.en;jsessionid=aj2UsCjxf1E_ Medieval Festival information] at Fenland District Council, URL accessed 21 October 2008[http://www.chatterishistoricfestival.co.uk/homepage.htm Chatteris Historic Festival homepage], URL accessed 16 November 2010

-The town has a museum run by volunteers, with several permanent exhibitions about local history, the Fens, Victoriana and the Railways.[http://www.chatterismuseum.org.uk/exhibits_and_displays.htm Chatteris Museum], URL accessed 21 May 2008 Chatteris also has a [[Boy Scout|Scout]] club, an [[Army Cadet Force|Army Cadet]] force and a youth football team.[http://www.chatterislinks.co.uk/Clubs/clubs.html Clubs in Chatteris], URL accessed 21 May 2008 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080511174826/http://www.chatterislinks.co.uk/Clubs/clubs.html |date=11 May 2008 }}[http://www.ctyfc.net/ Chatteris Town Youth Football Club], URL accessed 21 May 2008
+The town has a museum run by volunteers, with several permanent exhibitions about local history, the Fens, Victoriana and the Railways.[http://www.chatterismuseum.org.uk/exhibits_and_displays.htm Chatteris Museum], URL accessed 21 May 2008 Chatteris also has a [[Boy Scout|Scout]] club, an [[Army Cadet Force|Army Cadet]] force and a youth football team.[http://www.chatterislinks.co.uk/Clubs/clubs.html Clubs in Chatteris], URL accessed 21 May 2008 {{wayback|url=http://www.chatterislinks.co.uk/Clubs/clubs.html |date=20080511174826 |df=y }}[http://www.ctyfc.net/ Chatteris Town Youth Football Club], URL accessed 21 May 2008

Chatteris has morning and evening [[Women's Institutes]], which both meet at the King Edward Centre,[http://www.womens-institute.co.uk/institute.aspx?id=2026&fed=1459&inst=4482 Chatteris Women's Institute], URL accessed 21 May 2008 and a [[Rotary Club]] which meet at the local fire station, and put on an annual firework display, plus other events in the town.[http://www.chatteris-rotary.co.uk/ Chatteris Rotary Club], URL accessed 21 May 2008

@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@\n
'''Peter Aldis''' (11 April 1927 – 17 November 2008) was an [[England|English]] [[association football|footballer]] who played at full-back and appeared in 294 games for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in League and Cup.

He worked for local chocolate firm [[Cadbury plc|
-Cadbury's]] before joining Aston Villa from local side Hay Green in November 1948. He turned professional the following January.[http://www.lastingtribute.co.uk/tribute/aldis/2954384 Obituary] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090211062057/http://www.lastingtribute.co.uk/tribute/aldis/2954384 |date=February 11, 2009 }}
+Cadbury's]] before joining Aston Villa from local side Hay Green in November 1948. He turned professional the following January.[http://www.lastingtribute.co.uk/tribute/aldis/2954384 Obituary] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.lastingtribute.co.uk/tribute/aldis/2954384 |date=20090211062057 }}

==Football career==

@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@\n
| website = {{URL|www.ricolove.com}}
}}

-'''Richard Preston Butler, Jr.''' (born December 3, 1982), better known by his stage name '''Rico Love''', is an American singer-songwriter, record producer and rapper. He was born in [[New Orleans|New Orleans, Louisiana]], but split his childhood between [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] and New York City's Harlem neighborhood. He attended [[Florida A&M University|Florida A&M]] and, while visiting [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], worked his way into the music industry through connections with [[Usher (singer)|Usher]], who would become Love's mentor. The first song Love ever wrote in his career was "Throwback" for which ended up on Usher's 2004 album "[[Confessions (Usher album)|''Confessions'']]." Love success continued writing and producing hit records such as Usher's "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]" and "[[Hey Daddy (Daddy's Home)]]", [[Nelly]]'s "[[Just a Dream (Nelly song)|Just a Dream]]" and "[[Gone (Nelly song)|Gone]]", as well as [[Beyoncé Knowles]]' "[[Sweet Dreams (Beyoncé Knowles song)|Sweet Dreams]]".http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=705878http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=702982{{cite web|url=http://www.sesac.com/News/Article.aspx/2010/Summer/Rico%20Love |title=Rico Love |publisher=SESAC |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and has contributed to works which have gone on to win [[Grammy Award|Grammys]] such as Beyoncé's 2009 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[I Am... Sasha Fierce]]'',https://web.archive.org/web/20120503164723/http://www.grammy.com/nominees/search?artist=beyonce&title=&year=All&genre=All Usher's 2010 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[Raymond v. Raymond]]'', and Usher's 2010 Best Male R&B Vocal Performance "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]". In addition Love has written and produced records for [[Kelly Rowland]],{{cite web|url=http://www.starobserver.com.au/celebrity-2/2011/03/09/nelly-and-kelly-reunite/46788 |title=Nelly and Kelly reunite |work=Star Observer |date=March 9, 2011 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Diddy – Dirty Money]],{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/04/28/rico-love-says-diddy-dirty-money-album-will-be-worth-the-wait/ |title=Rico Love Says Diddy-Dirty Money Album Will Be Worth the Wait |publisher=Rap-Up.com |date=April 28, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Chris Brown (American entertainer)|Chris Brown]],{{cite web|url=http://neonlimelight.com/2010/07/09/exclusive-songwriter-rico-love-talks-chris-browns-amazing-songwriting-progress/ |title=Exclusive: Songwriter Rico Love Talks Chris Brown’s "Amazing" Songwriting Progress |publisher=Neonlimelight.com |date=July 9, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Alexandra Burke]], [[Keri Hilson]],{{cite web|url=http://theurbandaily.com/music/shamika-sanders/beyonces-songwriter-rico-love-the-music-business-is-like-high-school/ |title=Rico Love: The Music Industry Is Like High School |publisher=The Urban Daily |date=June 8, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]],{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/fergie-has-sex-and-the-citys-theme-labels-or-love-57108997.html |title=Fergie Has Sex and the City's Theme, 'Labels Or Love' |date=May 5, 2008 |location=California |publisher=Prnewswire.com |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and [[Fantasia Barrino|Fantasia]].http://thatgrapejuice.net/2010/05/rico-love-talks-fantasias-album-wanted-show-people-seductive-side/
+'''Richard Preston Butler, Jr.''' (born December 3, 1982), better known by his stage name '''Rico Love''', is an American singer-songwriter, record producer and rapper. He was born in [[New Orleans|New Orleans, Louisiana]], but split his childhood between [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] and New York City's Harlem neighborhood. He attended [[Florida A&M University|Florida A&M]] and, while visiting [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], worked his way into the music industry through connections with [[Usher (singer)|Usher]], who would become Love's mentor. The first song Love ever wrote in his career was "Throwback" for which ended up on Usher's 2004 album "[[Confessions (Usher album)|''Confessions'']]." Love success continued writing and producing hit records such as Usher's "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]" and "[[Hey Daddy (Daddy's Home)]]", [[Nelly]]'s "[[Just a Dream (Nelly song)|Just a Dream]]" and "[[Gone (Nelly song)|Gone]]", as well as [[Beyoncé Knowles]]' "[[Sweet Dreams (Beyoncé Knowles song)|Sweet Dreams]]".http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=705878http://www.sesac.com/Repertory/SongSearch.aspx?songNum=702982{{cite web|url=http://www.sesac.com/News/Article.aspx/2010/Summer/Rico%20Love |title=Rico Love |publisher=SESAC |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and has contributed to works which have gone on to win [[Grammy Award|Grammys]] such as Beyoncé's 2009 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[I Am... Sasha Fierce]]'',https://web.archive.org/web/20120503164723/http://www.grammy.com/nominees/search?artist=beyonce&title=&year=All&genre=All Usher's 2010 Best Contemporary R&B album ''[[Raymond v. Raymond]]'',[https://web.archive.org/web/20120503164723/http://www.grammy.com/nominees Nominees And Winners | GRAMMY.com] {{WebCite|url=http://www.webcitation.org/5n9wlZGhw|date =January 29, 2010}} and Usher's 2010 Best Male R&B Vocal Performance "[[There Goes My Baby (Usher song)|There Goes My Baby]]". In addition Love has written and produced records for [[Kelly Rowland]],{{cite web|url=http://www.starobserver.com.au/celebrity-2/2011/03/09/nelly-and-kelly-reunite/46788 |title=Nelly and Kelly reunite |work=Star Observer |date=March 9, 2011 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Diddy – Dirty Money]],{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/04/28/rico-love-says-diddy-dirty-money-album-will-be-worth-the-wait/ |title=Rico Love Says Diddy-Dirty Money Album Will Be Worth the Wait |publisher=Rap-Up.com |date=April 28, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Chris Brown (American entertainer)|Chris Brown]],{{cite web|url=http://neonlimelight.com/2010/07/09/exclusive-songwriter-rico-love-talks-chris-browns-amazing-songwriting-progress/ |title=Exclusive: Songwriter Rico Love Talks Chris Brown’s "Amazing" Songwriting Progress |publisher=Neonlimelight.com |date=July 9, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Alexandra Burke]], [[Keri Hilson]],{{cite web|url=http://theurbandaily.com/music/shamika-sanders/beyonces-songwriter-rico-love-the-music-business-is-like-high-school/ |title=Rico Love: The Music Industry Is Like High School |publisher=The Urban Daily |date=June 8, 2010 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]],{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/fergie-has-sex-and-the-citys-theme-labels-or-love-57108997.html |title=Fergie Has Sex and the City's Theme, 'Labels Or Love' |date=May 5, 2008 |location=California |publisher=Prnewswire.com |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and [[Fantasia Barrino|Fantasia]].http://thatgrapejuice.net/2010/05/rico-love-talks-fantasias-album-wanted-show-people-seductive-side/

Love is also the CEO of Division1, a record label which partnered with [[Interscope Records]] in 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.vibe.com/photo-galleries/rico-love-new-label-division-1-launch-party |title=Rico Love's Division 1/Universal Motown Launch Party |publisher=VIBE |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} Love has appeared as a featured artist on records with [[T.I.]],{{cite web|url=http://rapradar.com/2011/01/26/new-video-t-i-x-rico-love-lay-me-down/ |title=New Video: T.I. x Rico Love "Lay Me Down" |publisher=Rap Radar |date=January 26, 2011 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Usher (singer)|Ushe]]r,{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisrnb.com/2009/12/music-usher-feat-rico-love-shes-got-it/ |title=Music: Usher feat. Rico Love – She’s Got It |publisher=Thisisrnb.com |date=December 2, 2009 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Jermaine Dupri]],{{cite web|url=http://www.last.fm/music/Jermaine+Dupri/_/Gotta%2BGetcha%2B%2528Remix%2529%2B%2528Feat.%2BUsher%2B%2526%2BRico%2BLove%2529 |title=Jermaine Dupri – Gotta Getcha (Remix) (Feat. Usher & Rico Love) – Listening & stats at |publisher=Last.fm |date=February 11, 2009 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Jamie Foxx]],{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=ntt_srch_drd_B004FKJ3PE?ie=UTF8&search-type=ss&index=digital-music&field-keywords=Jamie%20Foxx%20Featuring%20Rico%20Love |title=Jamie Foxx Featuring Rico Love: MP3 Downloads |publisher=Amazon.com |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} [[Rich Boy]],{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphopmusicdotcom.com/rich-boy-ft-rico-love-we-like-it.html |title=Rich Boy ft. Rico Love – We Like It |publisher=Hiphopmusicdotcom.com |date=November 26, 2009 |accessdate=November 30, 2011}} and [[Fat Joe]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphoplead.com/music/fat-joe-ft-rico-love-no-problems/ |title=Fat Joe Ft. @@ -40,7 +40,7 @@\n

In 2007, Mandriva reached a deal with the Government of Nigeria to put their operating system on 17,000 school computers.

-On January 16, 2008, Mandriva and [[Turbolinux]] announced a partnership to create a lab named Manbo-Labs, to share resources and technology to release a common base system for both companies' Linux distributions.[http://www.turbolinux.com/cgi-bin/newsrelease/index.cgi?date2=20080016200602&mode=syosai Mandriva and Turbolinux announce a partnership and create a joint development lab called Manbo-Labs] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140912081620/http://www.turbolinux.com/cgi-bin/newsrelease/index.cgi?date2=20080016200602&mode=syosai |date=September 12, 2014 }}
+On January 16, 2008, Mandriva and [[Turbolinux]] announced a partnership to create a lab named Manbo-Labs, to share resources and technology to release a common base system for both companies' Linux distributions.[http://www.turbolinux.com/cgi-bin/newsrelease/index.cgi?date2=20080016200602&mode=syosai Mandriva and Turbolinux announce a partnership and create a joint development lab called Manbo-Labs] {{wayback|url=http://www.turbolinux.com/cgi-bin/newsrelease/index.cgi?date2=20080016200602&mode=syosai |date=20140912081620 }}

Although Mandriva's operating system eventually became a significant entity in the data center, the company's operating margins were thin and by 2012 the company was on the brink of bankruptcy.http://finance.yahoo.com/news/linux-company-spent-17-years-171430998.html On January 30, 2012, Mandriva announced that an external entity bid{{Clarify|Which external etity bid?|date=March 2014}} was rejected by a minority share holder and the deal did not go through. At the end of the first semester 2012, a solution to the situation that had appeared in January of the same year was found and a settlement achieved.{{Citation needed|date=January 2015}} Mandriva has since been owned by several different shareholders.{{cite web|title=Not This Time|url=http://blog.mandriva.com/en/2012/01/30/not-this-time/|date=2012-01-30|accessdate=2012-01-30}}

2016-11-14 04:57:10 749410382 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by Bender the Bot --- \n

@@ -1,20 +1,20 @@\n
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}}
{{Use British English|date=June 2013}}
[[File:Pro-test-June2006.jpg|right|thumb|A Pro-Test march on 3 June 2006, [[Oxford]], UK]]
-'''Pro-Test''' was a [[United Kingdom|British]] group that promoted and supported [[animal testing]] in [[medical research]]. It was founded on 29 January 2006 to counter [[SPEAK (animals)|SPEAK]], an animal-rights campaign opposing the construction by [[Oxford University]] of a [[Health science|biomedical]] and [[Animal testing|animal-research]] facility,[http://www.admin.ox.ac.uk/po/hcruling.shtml University of Oxford News Release: High Court Ruling] (10 November 2004) which SPEAK believes may include a [[primate]]-testing centre.[http://speakcampaigns.org.uk/primatelab.php SPEAK website: The New Primate Laboratory] (undated) {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20051201151235/http://speakcampaigns.org.uk/primatelab.php |date=December 1, 2005 }} Pro-Test held its first rally on 25 February 2006, attracting hundreds in support of the research facility and opposed by a smaller number of anti-lab demonstrators.[http://news.scotsman.com/latest.cfm?id=295032006 Marchers outnumber rights activists] (''[[The Scotsman]]'', 24 February 2006)
+'''Pro-Test''' was a [[United Kingdom|British]] group that promoted and supported [[animal testing]] in [[medical research]]. It was founded on 29 January 2006 to counter [[SPEAK (animals)|SPEAK]], an animal-rights campaign opposing the construction by [[Oxford University]] of a [[Health science|biomedical]] and [[Animal testing|animal-research]] facility,[http://www.admin.ox.ac.uk/po/hcruling.shtml University of Oxford News Release: High Court Ruling] (10 November 2004) which SPEAK believes may include a [[primate]]-testing centre.[http://speakcampaigns.org.uk/primatelab.php SPEAK website: The New Primate Laboratory] (undated) {{Wayback|date=20051201151235|url=http://speakcampaigns.org.uk/primatelab.php|df=yes}} Pro-Test held its first rally on 25 February 2006, attracting hundreds in support of the research facility and opposed by a smaller number of anti-lab demonstrators.[http://news.scotsman.com/latest.cfm?id=295032006 Marchers outnumber rights activists] (''[[The Scotsman]]'', 24 February 2006)

The group was founded by Laurie Pycroft from [[Swindon]] when he was 16. After forming the group, British newspapers described Pycroft as a "[[sixth form]] drop-out," "bedroom [[wikt:Blogger|blogger]],"[http://technology.guardian.co.uk/news/story/0,,1717620,00.html Bedroom blogger, 16, takes on animal rights protesters] (''[[The Guardian]]'', 25 February 2006) and "campaigning hero."[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,2087-2058853,00.html Focus: A campaigning hero] (''[[The Times]]'', 26 February 2006) It is now run by a committee of ten: academics ([[Tipu Aziz]], John Stein, and David Priestman), five Oxford graduate and undergraduate students, medical writer Alison Eden, and Pycroft.[http://www.pro-test.org.uk/ "The Pro-Test Committee"], Pro-Test website, retrieved 11 December 2007

-Pro-Test says that it stands for "science, reasoned debate and, above all, the welfare of mankind. … We support only non-violent [[protest]] and we condemn those using violence or intimidation to further their goals. We strongly support animal testing as crucially necessary to further medical science."[http://www.pro-test.org.uk/About.php Pro-Test website] (undated) {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081015165110/http://www.pro-test.org.uk/About.php |date=15 October 2008 }}
+Pro-Test says that it stands for "science, reasoned debate and, above all, the welfare of mankind. … We support only non-violent [[protest]] and we condemn those using violence or intimidation to further their goals. We strongly support animal testing as crucially necessary to further medical science."[http://www.pro-test.org.uk/About.php Pro-Test website] (undated) {{wayback|url=http://www.pro-test.org.uk/About.php |date=20081015165110 |df=y }}

In February 2011, five years after its first rally, Pro-Test wound up its activities, saying it had "successfully met its goals of defending the construction of the Oxford Lab, increasing awareness of the importance of animal research, and bringing the public on-side in support of life-saving medical research." Its US-based spin-off, Speaking of Research, remained active in the UK and US.

==Background==
The construction site of the [[Oxford]] research centre is located on [[South Parks Road]] behind a five-metre (15 ft) barrier. Construction work is carried out by workmen wearing balaclavas and using unmarked vehicles, after the first contractor, Walter Lilly, owned by Montpellier plc, pulled out in the face of threats.[http://www.guardian.co.uk/animalrights/story/0,,1716797,00.html?gusrc=rss Scientists to speak out for animal tests] (''[[The Guardian]]'', 24 February 2006) The facility is intended to become the "centre for all animal research at Oxford," according to Mark Matfield, former director of the [[Research Defence Society]],[http://www.the-scientist.com/news/20040720/02/ Activists halt Oxford lab] (''[[The Scientist (magazine)|The Scientist]]'' 20 July 2004) resulting in "the closure of a number of existing animal facilities".[http://www.admin.ox.ac.uk/po/biomed.shtml University of Oxford News Release: Biomedical research facility] (19 July 2004)

-The formation of Pro-Test coincided with threats made by the [[Animal Liberation Front]], against Oxford staff and students, on the ''[[Bite Back]]'' website.[http://www.animalliberationpressoffice.org/communiques/2006-02-02_oxford.htm Communiqué from ALF activists] (2 February 2006) {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060622213254/http://www.animalliberationpressoffice.org/communiques/2006-02-02_oxford.htm |date=22 June 2006 }} ALF spokesman, [[Robin Webb]] confirmed that "high-level student groups working against [[SPEAK (animals)|SPEAK]] protesters may be targeted."[http://www.oxfordstudent.com/ht2006wk3/news/students_will_be_the_next_target Students will be the next target] (''[[The Oxford Student]]'', 12 March 2006)
+The formation of Pro-Test coincided with threats made by the [[Animal Liberation Front]], against Oxford staff and students, on the ''[[Bite Back]]'' website.[http://www.animalliberationpressoffice.org/communiques/2006-02-02_oxford.htm Communiqué from ALF activists] (2 February 2006) {{wayback|url=http://www.animalliberationpressoffice.org/communiques/2006-02-02_oxford.htm |date=20060622213254 |df=y }} ALF spokesman, [[Robin Webb]] confirmed that "high-level student groups working against [[SPEAK (animals)|SPEAK]] protesters may be targeted."[http://www.oxfordstudent.com/ht2006wk3/news/students_will_be_the_next_target Students will be the next target] (''[[The Oxford Student]]'', 12 March 2006)

-Pycroft describes in his [[blog]], hosted at the [[LiveJournal]] website, how he set up Pro-Test after visiting his girlfriend in Oxford on 28 January 2006 and watching a SPEAK demonstration from the window of a coffee shop.[http://sqrrl101.livejournal.com/145774.html Science: 1 Ignorance: 0] (''[[LiveJournal]]'' entry, dated 28 January 2006)[http://www.pro-test.org.uk/Action.php Pro-Test website: Past Action] (undated) {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081015165115/http://www.pro-test.org.uk/Action.php |date=15 October 2008 }} Pycroft, his girlfriend, and one other, staged a personal counter-[[Demonstration (people)|demonstration]].
+Pycroft describes in his [[blog]], hosted at the [[LiveJournal]] website, how he set up Pro-Test after visiting his girlfriend in Oxford on 28 January 2006 and watching a SPEAK demonstration from the window of a coffee shop.[http://sqrrl101.livejournal.com/145774.html Science: 1 Ignorance: 0] (''[[LiveJournal]]'' entry, dated 28 January 2006)[http://www.pro-test.org.uk/Action.php Pro-Test website: Past Action] (undated) {{wayback|url=http://www.pro-test.org.uk/Action.php |date=20081015165115 |df=y }} Pycroft, his girlfriend, and one other, staged a personal counter-[[Demonstration (people)|demonstration]].

After writing about the experience on his blog, Pycroft has said he was receiving 300 hits an hour within days,[http://education.guardian.co.uk/students/comment/story/0,,1700196,00.html In praise of ... student protest] (''[[The Guardian]]'', 2 February 2006) and after attracting interest from the media, Oxford students, and the pro-animal-testing movement, he decided to schedule a second demonstration to coincide with a SPEAK protest on 25 February 2006. According to ''The Times'', "Pro-Test’s tactics mirror those of [[animal rights]] activists, with about 150 students using websites and chat forums to organise protests."[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,2-2019256,00.html Students fight back for animal research] (''[[The Times]]'' 1 February 2006)

==History==
{{Refimprove|date=December 2012}}
-On 10 October 1877 [[Louis IV, Grand Duke of Hesse|Ludwig IV, Großherzog von Hessen und bei Rhein (Grand Duke of Hessen)]], named the [[:de:Polytechnikum|Polytechnic School]] '''[[Technische Hochschule]] zu Darmstadt''' (Darmstadt Polytechnic) and thereby raised the status of this educational institution to that of a university so that the [[Abitur]] (diploma from German secondary school qualifying for university admission or matriculation) became the basis for admission. In 1899 the TH Darmstadt was granted the right to award doctorates.{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081023/http://www.tu-darmstadt.de/universitaet/profil_1/geschichte/historium_1.de.jsp |date=October 23, 2008 |title=Der Anfang war international, TU Darmstadt Homepage }}
+On 10 October 1877 [[Louis IV, Grand Duke of Hesse|Ludwig IV, Großherzog von Hessen und bei Rhein (Grand Duke of Hessen)]], named the [[:de:Polytechnikum|Polytechnic School]] '''[[Technische Hochschule]] zu Darmstadt''' (Darmstadt Polytechnic) and thereby raised the status of this educational institution to that of a university so that the [[Abitur]] (diploma from German secondary school qualifying for university admission or matriculation) became the basis for admission. In 1899 the TH Darmstadt was granted the right to award doctorates.{{Wayback |url=http://www.tu-darmstadt.de/universitaet/profil_1/geschichte/historium_1.de.jsp |title=Der Anfang war international, TU Darmstadt Homepage|date=20081023|df=yes }}

===Early beginnings===
The University's history is varied: its early phases began with the '''Höhere Gewerbschule''' (Higher Trade School), which was founded in 1836 and received its own building near the 'Altes Pädagog' on Kapellplatz in 1844, followed by the '''Technische Schule''' (Technical School) in 1864 and the '''Großherzoglich Hessische Polytechnische Schule''' (Grand Ducal Hessian Polytechnic) in 1868. At that time, heated discussions were continually held in political circles on the issue as to whether such a poor state as the Grand Duchy of [[Hessen]] could afford a technically oriented higher educational institution, or even a polytechnic. After the foundation of the '''TH Darmstadt''' in 1877, student numbers kept on being so low that in the years from 1881 to 1882 there were long debates in public about closing down the University. In this difficult situation, the local government and the University made the courageous decision to set up the first chair of [[electrical engineering]] worldwide. Thus the School of Electrical Engineering came into being as the sixth faculty of the TH Darmstadt, which was a novelty in academia, because until then no other polytechnic or university had had its own Faculty of Electrical Engineering. This forward-looking higher education policy paved the way for Darmstadt to take up a leading position in the rapidly developing field of Electrical Engineering, which in turn led to a continuously rising number of students, so that the closure of the TH Darmstadt never was demanded again.
2016-11-14 04:57:23 749410418 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by Dl2000 --- \n
+++ \n
@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@\n
Antoinette Halloran is a graduate of the [[Victorian College of the Arts]] where she won the Mabel Kent Scholarship and completed a Diploma of Arts (Voice); she has an [[Bachelor's degree|Honours Degree]] in Music from the [[University of Melbourne]]. In 1993, she studied at the [[New England Conservatory]] in Boston.

==Career==
-In 1997 Halloran appeared in the Australian film ''True Love And Chaos''.{{Imdb title|0117975|True Love And Chaos|(1996)}} Halloran also appeared on the 2000 album ''[[Since I Left You]]'' by the Australian electronic music group [[The Avalanches]].[http://www.cdconnection.com/details/Avalanches__Since_I_Left_You/940728?s=xCWgNXRO2716 ''Since I Left You'', notes and credits] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110708130343/http://www.cdconnection.com/details/Avalanches__Since_I_Left_You/940728?s=xCWgNXRO2716 |date=July 8, 2011 }} She played Gilda in ''Rigoletto – a perversion'' and Desdemona in ''Otello – a subversion'' for [[Theatreworks (Melbourne)|Theatreworks]] in their [[Giuseppe Verdi|Verdi]] [[trilogy]].[http://www.musictheatreaustralia.com.au/component/option,com_catalogue/catid,25/pid,2133294297/Itemid,33/listby,category/ Antoinette Halloran – profile (One Stop Entertainment)]
+In 1997 Halloran appeared in the Australian film ''True Love And Chaos''.{{Imdb title|0117975|True Love And Chaos|(1996)}} Halloran also appeared on the 2000 album ''[[Since I Left You]]'' by the Australian electronic music group [[The Avalanches]].[http://www.cdconnection.com/details/Avalanches__Since_I_Left_You/940728?s=xCWgNXRO2716 ''Since I Left You'', notes and credits] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.cdconnection.com/details/Avalanches__Since_I_Left_You/940728?s=xCWgNXRO2716 |date=20110708130343 }} She played Gilda in ''Rigoletto – a perversion'' and Desdemona in ''Otello – a subversion'' for [[Theatreworks (Melbourne)|Theatreworks]] in their [[Giuseppe Verdi|Verdi]] [[trilogy]].[http://www.musictheatreaustralia.com.au/component/option,com_catalogue/catid,25/pid,2133294297/Itemid,33/listby,category/ Antoinette Halloran – profile (One Stop Entertainment)]

Early in her career, she performed Mimì in [[Giacomo Puccini|Puccini]]'s ''[[La bohème]]'' for Oz Opera (the touring arm of [[Opera Australia]]); she would reprise that role several times in her career. In November 2002 she sang the title role in [[Jonathan Mills (composer)|Jonathan Mills]]'Jonathan Mills is since 2006 director of [[Edinburgh International Festival]] ''The Ghost Wife'' at the [[Barbican Centre]] in London with [[Richard Gill (conductor)|Richard Gill]] conducting.Dimity Shepherd also sang in that production of ''The Ghost Wife'', and she is part of "Opera Burlesque" and of DivasInc.[http://www.arts-archive.com/index.php?pg=12&action=performance&pid=L458979461&arch=Y Arts Archive: ''The Gost Wife'' at the Barbican]

@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@\n
In 2004, she toured Japan as [[Carlotta (The Phantom of the Opera)|Carlotta]] in [[Ken Hill (playwright)|Ken Hill]]’s ''[[Phantom of the Opera (1976 musical)|Phantom of the Opera]]'' and played the role of Mrs Segstrom for the [[Melbourne Theatre Company]] in their production of [[Stephen Sondheim|Sondheim]]'s ''[[A Little Night Music]]'' in Melbourne and Sydney.[http://www.allegromusic.com.au/index.php?option=com_directory&task=profile&lid=202 Biography (Allegro Music)] Also in 2004 Halloran was the winner of the Puccini Foundation Award of the Australian Acclaim Awards which enabled her to study under the Italian soprano Carla Maria Izzo and perform the roles of Kate Pinkerton in
Puccini's ''[[Madama Butterfly]]'' and Prima Ancella in ''[[Turandot]]'' at the prestigious [[Festival Puccini]] in [[Torre del Lago]], Italy.[http://www.acclaimawards.com.au/ The Acclaim Awards (see: About Acclaim)] She also represented Australia at the "International Hans Gabor Belvedere Singing Competition", conducted by the [[Wiener Kammeroper]].[http://www.opera-australia.org.au/scripts/nc.dll?OPRA:STANDARD:1001:pc=PC_90258 Short profile] ([[Opera Australia]])

-In 2006, she appeared with [[Ali McGregor]] and Dimity Shepherd in the show "Opera Burlesque" in the [[Spiegeltent]] "La Gayola" at the Edinburgh Festival[http://www.theatreguidelondon.co.uk/reviews/edinburgh2006-2.htm Edinburgh 2006]For "Opera Burlesque" see also [http://www.operaburlesque.com/home.html their home page] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080914140215/http://www.operaburlesque.com/home.html |date=September 14, 2008 }}
+In 2006, she appeared with [[Ali McGregor]] and Dimity Shepherd in the show "Opera Burlesque" in the [[Spiegeltent]] "La Gayola" at the Edinburgh Festival[http://www.theatreguidelondon.co.uk/reviews/edinburgh2006-2.htm Edinburgh 2006]For "Opera Burlesque" see also [http://www.operaburlesque.com/home.html their home page] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.operaburlesque.com/home.html |date=20080914140215 }}

Roles for Opera Australia proper include again Mimì in ''La bohème'', Despina in [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart|Mozart]]'s ''[[Così fan tutte]]'', Gianetta in [[Gilbert and Sullivan]]'s ''[[The Gondoliers]]'' and Josephine in ''[[H.M.S. Pinafore]]'', Ellen in [[Léo Delibes|Delibes]]' ''[[Lakmé]]''. On 14 January 2009, she stepped in as [[understudy]] for [[Cheryl Barker]] to sing Cio-Cio San in ''Madama Butterfly''.

@@ -32,7 +32,7 @@\n
===Corporate ventures===
Halloran originally performed with the classical performance group [[Pot-Pourri (group)|Pot-Pourri]]; having also reached an advanced level of classical ballet, she became later their choreographer and artistic consultant.[http://www.move.com.au/artist.cfm/180 Move (record label)]: [[Pot-Pourri (group)|Pot-Pourri]]

-Anoinette Halloran, Dimity Shepherd, Emily Whelan, Tiffany Speight, Danielle Calder, [[Ali McGregor]] form the group DivasInc ("Undercover Operators"), which specialises in bringing theatrical entertainment to corporate functions and concerts like [[Carols by Candlelight]].[http://www.divasinc.com.au/WhoAreWe.aspx DivasInc. Who are we?] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080913204114/http://www.divasinc.com.au/WhoAreWe.aspx |date=September 13, 2008 }}
+Anoinette Halloran, Dimity Shepherd, Emily Whelan, Tiffany Speight, Danielle Calder, [[Ali McGregor]] form the group DivasInc ("Undercover Operators"), which specialises in bringing theatrical entertainment to corporate functions and concerts like [[Carols by Candlelight]].[http://www.divasinc.com.au/WhoAreWe.aspx DivasInc. Who are we?] {{wayback|df=yes|url=http://www.divasinc.com.au/WhoAreWe.aspx |date=20080913204114 }}

==Recordings==
*''Rhythm of Life'' (1995) (with Pot-Pourri), Move Records, Cat. No.: MCD058
2016-11-14 05:31:49 749414694 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by JitsuFighter2 --- \n
+++ \n
@@ -29,7 +29,7 @@\n
In Durban, Arneil trained at a judo ''[[dojo]]'' (training hall) that also offered karate training. He made a practice of going down to the harbour and asking arriving Japanese people if they practised karate; if they did, he would invite them to training at the ''dojo''. In 1959, Arneil left South Africa, bound for Southeast Asia.Travers, P., & Travers, V. (2005): [http://www.ifkkyokushin.com/pdfs/Hanshi.pdf Hanshi Steve Arneil (9th Dan)] Retrieved on 14 March 2010.

==Japan==
-Arneil travelled to China, South Korea, and Hong Kong before arriving in Japan. He trained in a few karate styles, including [[Shotokan]], [[Wadō-ryū|Wado-ryu]], and [[Gōjū-ryū|Goju-ryu]] (under [[Gōgen Yamaguchi|Gogen Yamaguchi]]). In the course of these studies, the name "Oyama" was mentioned to him by several people, including Yamaguchi, and this aroused his curiosity. In January 1961, through [[Donn F. Draeger|Donn Draeger]], Arneil began to study Kyokushin karate under Masutatsu Oyama.{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070814062218/http://www.gra.hughes.btinternet.co.uk/okk/steve_arneil.html |date=14 August 2007 |title=Oldham Kyokushinkai Karate: Hanshi Steve Arneil, 9th Dan }} (c. 2005). Retrieved on 16 March 2010.{{dead link|date=November 2012|bot=Legobot}} He recalled that, unlike the other karate schools he had visited in Japan (who had welcomed him with minimal reservation), Oyama's Kyokushin school was selective; on their first meeting, Oyama told Arneil, "Remember, you asked me to train, I didn't ask you. You don't follow the rules, you out. Understand?"
+Arneil travelled to China, South Korea, and Hong Kong before arriving in Japan. He trained in a few karate styles, including [[Shotokan]], [[Wadō-ryū|Wado-ryu]], and [[Gōjū-ryū|Goju-ryu]] (under [[Gōgen Yamaguchi|Gogen Yamaguchi]]). In the course of these studies, the name "Oyama" was mentioned to him by several people, including Yamaguchi, and this aroused his curiosity. In January 1961, through [[Donn F. Draeger|Donn Draeger]], Arneil began to study Kyokushin karate under Masutatsu Oyama.{{Wayback |df=yes|date=20070814062218 |url=http://www.gra.hughes.btinternet.co.uk/okk/steve_arneil.html |title=Oldham Kyokushinkai Karate: Hanshi Steve Arneil, 9th Dan}} (c. 2005). Retrieved on 16 March 2010.{{dead link|date=November 2012|bot=Legobot}} He recalled that, unlike the other karate schools he had visited in Japan (who had welcomed him with minimal reservation), Oyama's Kyokushin school was selective; on their first meeting, Oyama told Arneil, "Remember, you asked me to train, I didn't ask you. You don't follow the rules, you out. Understand?"

Arneil was promoted to the rank of 1st ''dan'' in Kyokushin karate on 15 May 1962, and attained 2nd ''dan'' on 16 April 1963. He was later 'adopted' by Oyama, to allow him to marry a Japanese woman in 1964. Of his wife, Tsuyuko Arneil, he has said, "She worked in a bank, and she supported both of us when I was training. I didn't have time for work." Arneil estimated that he trained an average of six hours each day during his time in Japan, with training normally commencing at 10:00 AM and concluding between 10:30 PM to 1:00 AM the next morning.
2016-11-14 05:07:56 749411797 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by KasparBot --- \n

-'''Henry Bertram Mayo''', [[PhD|D.Phil]], [[Royal Society of Canada|FRSC]], ({{birth date|1911|6|17|df=yes}}—{{Death date|2009|1|15|df=yes}}) was a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[political scientist]]. At the time of his death, he was Canada's oldest living [[Rhodes Scholar]],[http://www.munalum.ca/luminus/luminus2006/fall/alumniconnections/ Luminus - Fall/Winter 2006/07 Vol. 31 No. 2 | Alumni Connections] and professor emeritus at [[Carleton University]], [[Ottawa]].[http://www.carleton.ca/polisci/Faculty/index.html Carleton University - Department of Political Science] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070713225955/http://www.carleton.ca/polisci/Faculty/index.html |date=July 13, 2007 }} Born in [[Fortune, Newfoundland|Fortune]], [[Dominion of Newfoundland|Newfoundland]], Mayo taught at a number of universities, received multiple honorary degrees and was president of the [[Canadian Political Science Association]].[http://www.cpsa-acsp.ca/template_e.cfm?folder=about&page_name=presidents.htm CPSA Presidents / Présidents ACSP] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070815082352/http://www.cpsa-acsp.ca/template_e.cfm?folder=about&page_name=presidents.htm |date=August 15, 2007 }}
+'''Henry Bertram Mayo''', [[PhD|D.Phil]], [[Royal Society of Canada|FRSC]], ({{birth date|1911|6|17|df=yes}}—{{Death date|2009|1|15|df=yes}}) was a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[political scientist]]. At the time of his death, he was Canada's oldest living [[Rhodes Scholar]],[http://www.munalum.ca/luminus/luminus2006/fall/alumniconnections/ Luminus - Fall/Winter 2006/07 Vol. 31 No. 2 | Alumni Connections] and professor emeritus at [[Carleton University]], [[Ottawa]].[http://www.carleton.ca/polisci/Faculty/index.html Carleton University - Department of Political Science] {{wayback|url=http://www.carleton.ca/polisci/Faculty/index.html |date=20070713225955 }} Born in [[Fortune, Newfoundland|Fortune]], [[Dominion of Newfoundland|Newfoundland]], Mayo taught at a number of universities, received multiple honorary degrees and was president of the [[Canadian Political Science Association]].[http://www.cpsa-acsp.ca/template_e.cfm?folder=about&page_name=presidents.htm CPSA Presidents / Présidents ACSP] {{wayback|url=http://www.cpsa-acsp.ca/template_e.cfm?folder=about&page_name=presidents.htm |date=20070815082352 }}

-The '''Slimnic River''' is a left [[tributary]] of the river [[Coțatcu River|Coțatcu]] in [[Romania]].Ovidiu Gabor - {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090305111215/http://www.riob.org/euro-riob/cracovie/27_sep_2004/costrecoverymechanism.pdf |date=March 5, 2009 |title=Economic Mechanism in Water Management }}, map page 10 It discharges into the Râmnicul Sărat near [[Vâjâitoarea]]. The upper reach of the river is sometimes referred to as ''Tâmboești''. It flows through the villages [[Bordeștii de Jos]], [[Tâmboești]], [[Tâmboești|Slimnic]], [[Obrejița]], [[Sihlea]] and [[Sihlea|Bogza]].
+The '''Slimnic River''' is a left [[tributary]] of the river [[Coțatcu River|Coțatcu]] in [[Romania]].Ovidiu Gabor - {{Wayback |url=http://www.riob.org/euro-riob/cracovie/27_sep_2004/costrecoverymechanism.pdf|title=Economic Mechanism in Water Management|date=20090305111215 |df=yes }}, map page 10 It discharges into the Râmnicul Sărat near [[Vâjâitoarea]]. The upper reach of the river is sometimes referred to as ''Tâmboești''. It flows through the villages [[Bordeștii de Jos]], [[Tâmboești]], [[Tâmboești|Slimnic]], [[Obrejița]], [[Sihlea]] and [[Sihlea|Bogza]].

2016-11-14 05:15:33 749412649 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by Sabbatino --- \n

@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@\n
==Biography==
Born to [[Lithuanian people|Lithuanian]] parents on 19 May 1954, in [[Melbourne]], Rudd began playing drums in his teens and became quite serious about pursuing a career in music.{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/phil-rudd-mn0000287379|title=Phil Rudd|author=Eduardo Rivadavia|work=AllMusic}} He played in several bands in Melbourne before joining [[Buster Brown (Australian band)|Buster Brown]] with future [[Rose Tattoo]] vocalist [[Angry Anderson]].{{cite web | url = http://hem.passagen.se/honga/database/b/busterbrown.html | work = [[Australian Rock Database]] | title = Buster Brown | publisher = Magnus Holmgren | last1 = Holmgren | first1 = Magnus | accessdate = 18 June 2011 }} They went on to release one album, ''Something To Say'', in 1974, before Rudd left to join the Coloured Balls with [[Lobby Loyde]].

-In 1974 Rudd was told about AC/DC's rhythm section auditions by his former Coloured Balls bandmate Trevor Young (no relation to AC/DC's Young brothers). Rudd asked Buster Brown bassist Geordie Leach to accompany him to the auditions, but Leach refused due to other commitments. Rudd auditioned and was hired immediately.Engleheart, Murray ''AC/DC – Maximum Rock N Roll'' 2003 ISBN 0-7322-8383-3 Rudd's drumming style suited the band's style of music and became an integral part of AC/DC's sound from 1975 to 1983.[[Ian McFarlane|McFarlane, Ian]] (1999) ''[[Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop]]'' {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040806010608/www.whammo.com.au/encyclopedia.asp?articleid=9 |date=August 6, 2004 |title='AC/DC' entry }}. Archived from [http://www.whammo.com.au/encyclopedia.asp?articleid=9 the original] on 6 August 2004. Retrieved 18 June 2011. The band relocated to the United Kingdom in 1976 and followed a heavy schedule of international touring and recording.
+In 1974 Rudd was told about AC/DC's rhythm section auditions by his former Coloured Balls bandmate Trevor Young (no relation to AC/DC's Young brothers). Rudd asked Buster Brown bassist Geordie Leach to accompany him to the auditions, but Leach refused due to other commitments. Rudd auditioned and was hired immediately.Engleheart, Murray ''AC/DC – Maximum Rock N Roll'' 2003 ISBN 0-7322-8383-3 Rudd's drumming style suited the band's style of music and became an integral part of AC/DC's sound from 1975 to 1983.[[Ian McFarlane|McFarlane, Ian]] (1999) ''[[Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop]]'' {{Wayback |df=yes|date=20040806010608 |url=www.whammo.com.au/encyclopedia.asp?articleid=9 |title='AC/DC' entry}}. Archived from [http://www.whammo.com.au/encyclopedia.asp?articleid=9 the original] on 6 August 2004. Retrieved 18 June 2011. The band relocated to the United Kingdom in 1976 and followed a heavy schedule of international touring and recording.

===Leaving AC/DC===
In 1980, AC/DC's vocalist [[Bon Scott]] died. The band continued on, recruiting new vocalist [[Brian Johnson]] and subsequently recording their most successful album, 1980's ''[[Back in Black]]''. Good friends, Rudd took Scott's death badly, but continued on with AC/DC until he left the band during the recording of the ''[[Flick of the Switch]]'' album in 1983. Rudd had completed his contributions to the album, and although session drummer [[B.J. Wilson]] was recruited to help complete the recording, Wilson's drum parts were ultimately not used. [[Simon Wright (musician)|Simon Wright]] was soon hired as Rudd's permanent replacement, and featured in the [[music video|videos]] that accompanied the singles released from the album.

2016-11-14 05:07:30 749411736 Fluxbot GreenC bot Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/GreenC bot|GreenC bot]] ([[User talk:GreenC bot|talk]]) to last version by 95.133.211.190 --- \n
